variant.obsolete: Replaced by split out versions below.

variant.name: .Unknown
variant.summary: unknown but not the default search engine

histogram.name: AccountManager.AccountAdditionResultStatus
histogram.summary: Records the result of in-session account addition (or re-authentication) triggers on Chrome OS. This is recorded whenever an in-session account addition (or re-authentication) is triggered and user finishes or cancels the flow.

histogram.name: AccountManager.AccountAdditionSource
histogram.summary: Records the source of in-session account addition (or re-authentication) triggers on Chrome OS. This is recorded whenever an in-session account addition (or re-authentication) is triggered - either explicitely by the user, or automatically by Gaia (for accounts requiring immediate re-authentication).

histogram.name: AccountManager.EduCoexistence.CreateRaptResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M91. Deprecated after v2 EduCoexistence.
histogram.summary: The result of creating a Reauth Proof Token (RAPT) for the parent in secondary EDU account addition flow. Recorded after parent enters their password and child access token is fetched.

histogram.name: AccountManager.EduCoexistence.FetchAccessTokenResult
histogram.summary: The result of fetching an access token for the child with |accounts.reauth| scope in secondary EDU account addition flow. Recorded after parent enters their password. This metric covers both v1 and v2 of EduCoexistence.

histogram.name: AccountManager.EduCoexistence.FetchParentsListResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M91. Deprecated after v2 EduCoexistence.
histogram.summary: The result of fetching a list of parents in secondary EDU account addition flow. Recorded when user opens 'Add EDU account' flow.

histogram.name: AccountManager.EduCoexistence.FlowResult
histogram.summary: Records the last completed step in the EDU account addition flow. Allows to track the drop rate by screen.

histogram.name: AccountManager.EduCoexistenceV2.InSessionFlowResult
histogram.summary: Records the last completed step in the EDU account addition flow. Allows to track the drop rate by important states during the in session flow.

histogram.name: AccountManager.EduCoexistenceV2.OnboardingFlowResult
histogram.summary: Records the last completed step in the EDU account addition flow. Allows to track the drop rate by important states during onboarding.

histogram.name: AccountManager.InitializationTime
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken to fully initialize Chrome OS Account Manager. This is recorded once per user session, at login time.

histogram.name: AccountManager.ManageAccountsServiceType
histogram.summary: Tracks the service type received with the mirror response header.

histogram.name: AccountManager.Migrations.Result
histogram.summary: Tracks the final result of migrating accounts to Chrome OS Account Manager. This is recorded only once per session, at login time.

histogram.name: AccountManager.Migrations.StepResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of individual migration steps of migrating accounts to Chrome OS Account Manager. This is recorded only once per session, at login time.

histogram.name: AccountManager.MirrorReauthenticationRequest
histogram.summary: Whether user has received a Mirror re-authentication request for account with invalid cookies. Recorded when we open a re-authentication dialog for the invalid account. See https://crbug.com/1012649 for details.

histogram.name: AccountManager.NumAccounts
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of accounts stored in Chrome OS Account Manager by a given user. This is recorded only once per session, at login time.

histogram.name: AccountManager.TokenLoadStatus
histogram.summary: Tracks the status of token loads from disk by Chrome OS Account Manager, for a given user. This is recorded only once per session, at login time.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.AnalyzerCreationError
histogram.summary: The analyzer creation error code. Logged each time analyzer creation fails, at most once per processed stability debug file.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.InitStatus
histogram.summary: Status of the initialization to collect stability debug files. Logged once, during the initialization of the stability debug file collection.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.StabilityFileCount
histogram.summary: Number of files found during stability file collection. Logged each time the stability file collection proceeds (at most once per launch).

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.Status
histogram.summary: Status for the collection of a stability debug file. Logged each time a debug file collection attempt is made.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.SystemSessionAnalysisStatus
histogram.summary: Status for the analysis of the system session state. Logged each time a debug file is collected.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.TotalTime
histogram.summary: Time spent collecting stability debug information. Logged each time a collection is performed.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.WriteDumpStatus
histogram.summary: Status of the minidump writing. Logged each time a writing a minidump is attempted.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.CollectCrash.Event
histogram.summary: Events that occur during crash collection of the debug file. Logged each time an event of interest occurs during crash debug file collection.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.CollectCrash.Status
histogram.summary: Status for the collection of a stability debug file. Logged each time a debug file collection attempt is made from the crash handler.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Record.Event
histogram.summary: Events pertaining to recording to the debug file. Logged each time an event of interest occurs wrt debug file recording.

histogram.name: AddSupervisionDialog.Enrollment
histogram.summary: Records the number of users who go through the Add Supervision process to convert regular accounts to Geller accounts. Initiated count is incremented when Add Supervision dialog is opened. Completed count is incremented when supervision is successfully enrolled. Signed out count is incremented when the user clicks "Sign out" after enrollment at the end of the process in the dialog. Closed count is incremented when the Add Supervision dialog is closed prior to enrollment, excluding sign out. Switched accounts count is incremented when the user clicks "Sign out" within the dialog to swich accounts before enrollment completion.

histogram.name: AddSupervisionDialog.EnrollmentCompletedUserTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time in milliseconds for users to successfully enroll in supervision.

histogram.name: AddSupervisionDialog.EnrollmentNotCompletedUserTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time in milliseconds for users to exit the Add Supervision dialog without enrollment. This can happen if the user closes the Add Supervision dialog or signs out to switch accounts.

histogram.name: AddSupervisionDialog.SignoutCompletedUserTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time in milliseconds for users to sign out after enrolling in supervision. Elapsed time is measured starting from when the Add Supervision dialog was first opened.

histogram.name: Ads.Media.Duration
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of HTML5 media (when known). Only recorded for media within ad subframes. This is recorded every time the duration changes for a video, and can be recorded multiple times for a single video (the overall duration may not be known when loading starts). Because the duration will generally increase as more video gets buffered, this histogram may skew low.

histogram.name: Ads.Media.LoadType
histogram.summary: Load type of HTML5 media in ad subframes such as URL, MediaSource and MediaStream.

histogram.name: Ads.ResourceUsage.Size.Cache2
histogram.summary: For a given resource fetched from the disk cache or blink memory cache, logs the encoded body length of the resource, even if the resource request was canceled or incomplete. Recorded when the resource request is complete, or when the page is destroyed/navigated for incomplete resources. The sum of samples across a page load may differ substatially from the true sum due to per-sample rounding. These are not intended to be compared to page level histograms.

histogram.name: Ads.ResourceUsage.Size.Network
histogram.summary: For a given resource fetched from the network, logs the network bytes used to load the resource (including headers), even if the resource request was canceled or incomplete. Recorded when the resource request is complete, or when the page is destroyed/navigated for incomplete resources. The sum of samples across a page load may differ substatially from the true sum due to per-sample rounding. These are not intended to be compared to page level histograms.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.OnDSE.SameHost
histogram.summary: True if the target link of the anchor element has the same host as the root document. Recorded only on default search engine pages.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.OnNonDSE.SameHost
histogram.summary: True if the target link of the anchor element has the same host as the root document. Recorded only on pages whose URL do not match the default search engine.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.IsSameHost
histogram.summary: True if the target link of the anchor element has the same host as the root document.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Visible.NumberOfAnchorElementsAfterMerge
histogram.summary: The number of anchor element metrics sent to the browser process on a page load. Anchor elements having the same href are merged and counted as 1. This histogram is recorded when the webpage is loaded.

histogram.name: AnimatedImage.NumOfFramesSkipped
histogram.summary: If the frame rate for the image animation can not be reached, frames in the animation are skipped to catch up to the desired frame. This metric tracks the number of frames skipped during catch up, and can be used to assess the smoothness of these animations. It records the number of frames skipped each time the animation is ticked forward to draw the next frame. In the ideal case, where the animation can be drawn at the desired rate, 0 frames should be skipped. Note that skipping of frames can also be triggered if the animation was intentionally paused (on becoming off-screen, or the tab being hidden).

histogram.name: Animation.AnimationWorklet.Dispatcher.AsynchronousMutateDuration
histogram.summary:
The time it takes the WorkletMutatorDispatcher to complete an asynchronous mutation request of animation worklet. The measured time is the total elapsed time from when a request is queued until the results are received.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Animation.AnimationWorklet.Dispatcher.SynchronousMutateDuration
histogram.summary:
The time it takes the WorkletMutatorDispatcher to dispatch to and mutate all animation worklet mutators synchronously. This includes the time that it takes each AnimationWorkletGlobalScope to produce its output (which includes V8 script execution) and also any queuing cost associated with posting mutation tasks and receiving responses.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Animation.AnimationWorklet.MutateDuration
histogram.summary:
The time it takes for an AnimationWorklet to produce a mutation update. This includes all V8 script execution cost.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: API.StorageAccess.AllowedRequests
histogram.summary: Records if various requests to access storage are allowed or not and if the Storage Access API unblocked the request or not. Recorded whenever a decision to access storage like getting/setting cookies or opening an indexeddb connection is made in CookieSettings.

histogram.name: API.StorageAccess.GrantIsImplicit
histogram.summary: Records if a generated grant was implicit or explicit at the time it was created.

histogram.name: API.StorageAccess.RequestStorageAccess
histogram.summary: Records requests to use document.requestStorageAccess and reasons the request may be approved or rejected.

histogram.name: AppBanners.BeforeInstallEvent
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks usage of the BeforeInstallPromptEvent, which allows developers to control when an app banner appears. The events in this histogram are not mutually exclusive - for example, preventDefault() must be called if prompt() is called.

histogram.name: AppBanners.DismissEvent
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks the different ways that an app banner left the screen, e.g. through an automatic dismissal after navigation or an explicit user action.

histogram.name: AppBanners.DisplayEvent
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks when an app banner was requested and how the request was handled, e.g. the user blocked its appearance or the banner was ultimately created.

histogram.name: AppBanners.InstallableStatusCode
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks the status code logged by the app banner system as it processes a site's eligibility for an app banner. Every request for a banner will be logged in a bucket of this histogram.

histogram.name: AppBanners.InstallEvent
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks when a user triggers an install dialog for the app promoted by the banner, as well as whether or not the user ultimately decided to install the app.

histogram.name: AppBanners.MinutesFromFirstVisitToBannerShown
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks the number of minutes between the first recorded visit to an origin and the time when the banner is actually shown.

histogram.name: AppBanners.UserResponse
histogram.summary: This stat tracks the user reponse when the add-to-homescreen dialog is shown either: (A) Via the website's JavaScript (B) Via the user tapping the app banner which promotes the application related to the current site.

histogram.name: appcache.Manifest.ChromeHeader
histogram.summary: The proportion of manifests that use the Chrome-specific header. Only tracks manifests that were successfully parsed.

histogram.name: appcache.Manifest.DangerousMode
histogram.summary: The proportion of manifests parsed with dangerous features enabled. Only tracks manifests that were successfully parsed.

histogram.name: appcache.Manifest.InterceptUsage
histogram.summary: Usage of CHROMIUM-INTERCEPT entries in AppCache manifests. Only tracks manifests that were successfully parsed.

histogram.name: appcache.ReinitAttempt
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times the appcache reinit process occurs. The boolean value indicates whether it was a repeated attempt to reinitialize during a browsing session.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJob.Canceled
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the update job was canceled.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJob.ExistingCorruptionFixedInUpdate
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times we encountered corruption and fixed it while handling a 304 response. We only attempt to recover corruption during 304 response handling, so for any corrupt caches that exist and don't trigger a conditional request, these cases can't result in the possibility of fixing corruption through this path.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJob.ExistingResourceCheck
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times we plan to check whether we can reuse existing resources.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJob.ExistingResourceCorrupt
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times we encounter a corrupt resource while checking if we can reuse an existing resource. This is only called when we find a corrupt resource, so any resources that are corrupt but aren't tested won't be included in this count. If all resources are non-corrupt, then the default value (0) will be sent for metrics collection.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJob.ExistingResourceCorruptionRecovery
histogram.summary:
Tracks the number of times we encountered a corrupt resource and chose to recover the corruption by refetching the resource in a non-conditional request. This metric is always emitted upon AppCacheUpdateJob destruction and is only incremented when the corruption recovery feature is enabled and a corrupt resource is detected. If either corruption recovery is disabled or no corrupt resources are recovered, then this will not be emitted.
This metric was enabled in M81 (Dec 19, 2019), disabled in M82 (Feb 18, 2020), and re-enabled in M86 (Aug 2020). In M86 this includes 0 values (no corruption recovered), but in M87 and later it does not.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJob.ExistingResourceNotCorrupt
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times we encounter a non-corrupt resource while checking if we can reuse an existing resource. This is only called when we find a non-corrupt resource, so any resources that aren't corrupt but aren't tested won't be included in this count. If all resources are corrupt, then the default value (0) will be sent for metrics collection.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJob.ExistingResourceOnlyCorrupt
histogram.summary:
Tracks the number of times we encounter a corrupt resource while checking if we can reuse an existing resource. This is only called when we find a corrupt resource, so any resources that are corrupt but aren't tested won't be included in this count.
Unlike ExistingResourceCorrupt this is only emitted when there are any corrupt resources found.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJob.ExistingResourceOnlyNotCorrupt
histogram.summary:
Tracks the number of times we encounter a non-corrupt resource while checking if we can reuse an existing resource. This is only called when we find a non-corrupt resource, so any resources that aren't corrupt but aren't tested won't be included in this count.
Unlike ExistingResourceNotCorrupt this is only emitted when there are any non-corrupt resources found.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJob.ExistingResourceReused
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times while checking existing resources that we determined we can reuse that resource.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJob.FinalInternalState
histogram.summary: Tracks the final internal state for the update job.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJob.ResourceFreshness
histogram.summary: Tracks the resource freshness we cached in a response as we consider whether we can reuse an existing resource. This metric is in days and typically reflects the Cache-Control: max-age=X server response header. It may indicate the Expires: header in some cases at the time of the response if a max-age header was not provided. Note that max-age is in seconds and we're generally interested in a range of 0 days to ~1 year.

histogram.name: AppleScript.CommandEvent
histogram.summary: The number of times an AppleScript event gets called.

histogram.name: AppManagement.AppDetailViews
histogram.summary: The actions taken by the user when they are viewing the app details of an app in App Management (chrome://os-settings/app-management).

histogram.name: AppManagement.EntryPoints
histogram.summary: The ways the user opens up the App Management interface.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigChange
histogram.summary: Whether DnsConfigService::OnConfigChange actually corresponded to a change in DnsConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigNotifyInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time between calls to DnsConfigService::InvalidateConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParseDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent parsing DnsConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParsePosix
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsConfig in DnsConfigServicePosix.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParseWin
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsConfig in DnsConfigServiceWin.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostParseResult
histogram.summary: Whether DnsHosts were parsed successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsChange
histogram.summary: Whether DnsConfigService::OnHostsChange actually corresponded to a change in DnsHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsNotifyInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time between calls to DnsConfigService::InvalidateHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsParseDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent parsing DnsHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsParseWin
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsHosts in DnsConfigServiceWin.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerCount
histogram.summary: Count of servers in DnsConfig. Recorded on every new DnsSession, which is created on DNS change.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UnchangedConfigInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time since the last empty config result to the time a non-change OnConfigChange is received.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UnchangedHostsInterval
histogram.summary: Duration of time since the last empty config result to the time a non-change OnHostsChange is received.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.WatchStatus
histogram.summary: The result of DnsConfigService watch. Counts STARTED on every initialization and FAILED_* on any failure.

histogram.name: Aura.CreatedGpuBrowserCompositor
histogram.summary: Whether the browser compositor uses GPU or the software renderer.

histogram.name: Aura.WebContentsWindowUnOccludedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent painting a WebContents frame when a window switches from occluded to visible state.

histogram.name: Autocomplete.Cleanup
histogram.summary: Logged when the Autocomplete Retention Policy cleaned up expired entries. Expired entries are entries that haven't been used in the last 14 months.

histogram.name: Autocomplete.DaysSinceLastUse
histogram.summary: Logged when users select Autocomplete entries in the dropdown, this histogram captures the number of days that have passed since the selected autocomplete entry was last used. I.e., the distribution of time between uses of an "active" autocomplete entry.

histogram.name: Autocomplete.Events
histogram.summary:
Autocomplete events recorded when the user interacts with suggestions served from Autocomplete.
Note that this histogram was disabled after M85 and was only reenabled on 25.02.2021.

histogram.name: Autocomplete.MatchType
histogram.summary: Type of AutocompleteMatch. Recorded every time the autocomplete action predictor in omnibox triggers a preresolve, or a preconnect.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.AccurateCount
histogram.summary: Every time we calculate the confidence for a URL to determine if it should be prerendered, we track the URL and confidence calculated. When an Omnibox navigation happens, if we calculated a confidence for that URL, a count is incremented for the confidence that was calculated. This histogram is then a histogram of counts that relates the number of correctly predicted URLs to a confidence value. By comparing that number to the AutocompleteActionPredictor.NavigationCount and Prerender.OmniboxNavigationsUsedPrerenderCount histograms, it's possible to determine the effect of changing the confidence threshold on the accuracy of prerendering prediction.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.Action
histogram.summary: The distribution of network actions recommended by the AutocompleteActionPredictor. A network action can be one of the enumerated AutocompleteActionPredictor::Action values: PRERENDER, PRECONNECT, or NONE. The AutocompleteActionPredictor recommends one of these based on a confidence score for a given URL and user-entered text pair.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.Confidence
histogram.summary: The distribution of confidence ratings. The AutocompleteActionPredictor uses a heuristic to calculate a confidence score given a URL and user-entered text pair. It is in the range [0,1] and is mapped on to a recommended action, one of the enumerated AutocompleteActionPredictor::Action values: PRERENDER, PRECONNECT or NONE. This is the distribution of those scores multiplied by 100.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.DatabaseAction
histogram.summary: Trackes the number of times something is added, removed, or deleted from the AutocompleteActionPredictor backing database.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.DatabaseRowCount
histogram.summary: The distribution of row counts for the AutocompleteActionPredictorDatabase. Each row contains information regarding the user's Omnibox use history.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.MatchIsInDb
histogram.summary: A boolean that indicates if the autocomplete suggestion under consideration by the AutocompleteActionPredictor was found in the database. This gives an upper bound on the fraction of suggestions it is possible to calculate a confidence for, and thus an upper bound on the fraction of suggestions that can be prerendered.

histogram.name: AutocompleteActionPredictor.NavigationCount
histogram.summary: The number of navigations triggered by the Omnibox and seen by the AutocompleteActionPredictor. This triggers when the Omnibox is showing Autocomplete results to the user and they select one with the mouse or by pressing enter.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.CacheEntryAge
histogram.summary: How old a cached probe result was when it was used, in hours.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.DidSucceed
histogram.summary: Records the completion status of a probe when it completes each attempt.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.DidSucceed.AfterReportedFailure
histogram.summary: Records the completion status of a probe retry after an externally reported failure.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.FinalState
histogram.summary: Records the end state of a probe just before it goes inactive. This happens when the prober succeeds, fails and has no more retries, or the delegate stops probing.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.NetError
histogram.summary: Records the net error of a completed or timed out probe. Note that if a HTTP response does not occur within the probe's TTL, when a sample will also be added to the ERR_TIMED_OUT bucket.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.NumAttemptsBeforeSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the number of attempts that are made to achieve a successful probe result. Only recorded on success. This metric is 1-based so if a probe succeeds the first time, a sample of 1 will be recorded.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: Records the HTTP response code of a completed probe, when a HTTP response is received.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.TimeUntilFailure2
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time spent working on a single probe attempt to get to a failed state. Recorded every time a probe fails.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.TimeUntilSuccess2
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time spent working on a single probe attempt to get to a successful state. Recorded every time a probe succeeds.

histogram.name: Badging.AppBadgeUpdate.Mac.Result
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M88 as it's no longer needed.
histogram.summary: The result from updating the app badge on macOS.

histogram.name: BatteryStatus.NumberBatteriesLinux
histogram.summary: Number of batteries reported by the UPower service on Linux at the start of the Battery Status API.

histogram.name: BatteryStatus.NumberBatteriesMac
histogram.summary: Number of internal batteries reported by MacOS at the start of the Battery Status API.

histogram.name: BatteryStatus.NumberBatteriesWin
histogram.summary: Number of batteries reported by Windows at the start of the Battery Status API.

histogram.name: BatteryStatus.StartAndroid
histogram.summary: Whether the Battery Status API was successfully started up on Android.

histogram.name: Blimp.Compositor.CommitSizeKb
histogram.summary: Records the size of the uncompressed commit messages received by Blimp compositor.

histogram.name: Blimp.Connected
histogram.summary: Records whether connection attempt to the Blimp engine was successful.

histogram.name: Blimp.Supported
histogram.summary: Records whether Blimp is supported.

histogram.name: Blimp.Tab.Visible
histogram.summary: Records whenever a Blimp tab toggles visibility.

histogram.name: BlueZ.AdapterLost
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records a duration of a Bluetooth adapter being lost. This helps us better understand the Bluetooth controller drop issue in the field.

histogram.name: BlueZ.AdvertisementMonitor.NumOfMonitors
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the number of active advertisement monitors every couple of minutes. This helps us to gauge the additional power requirement for the advertisement monitor feature.

histogram.name: BlueZ.AdvertisementMonitor.{Filter}.FilterPatternsPerMinute
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the number of advertisement packet received in the user space while the advertisement monitor is done using {Filter} filtering. This helps us to gauge the additional power requirement for the advertisement monitor feature.

histogram.name: BlueZ.AdvertisementMonitor.{Filter}.{Operation}.Result
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the outcome of {Operation} operation of advertisement monitor when {Filter} filtering is used. This helps us to verify the correctness of this feature as well as to point out possible regression.

histogram.name: BlueZ.ChipLost2
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records a duration of a Bluetooth adapter being lost caused by hardware disconnection. This helps us better understand the Bluetooth controller drop issue in the field.

histogram.name: BlueZ.NumberOfExistingAdvertisements
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the number of existing advertisements when registering for a new advertisement. This helps us better understand the common amount of advertisments used and the registration failures due to the limited number of advertisement slots.

histogram.name: BlueZ.PerProfile.ConnectionResult
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of bluetooth profile connection request to a remote device. This helps to understand the percentage of successful profile connections against failures and the causes of failures.

histogram.name: BlueZ.PerProfile.ProbingResult
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of bluetooth profile probing while pairing with a remote device. This helps to understand the percentage of successful profile probing against failures and the causes of failures.

histogram.name: BlueZ.ReasonOfDisconnection
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the reason of Bluetooth disconnection between the local device and the remote Bluetooth device. This helps us better understand the initiator of disconnection request.

histogram.name: BlueZ.ResultOfAdvertisementRegistration
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the outcomes of advertisement registration. This helps us better understand the persentage of successful advertisements against failures and the causes of failures.

histogram.name: BlueZ.ResultOfConnection
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the outcomes of connection requests to remote devices. This helps us better understand the persentage of successful connections against failures and the causes of failures.

histogram.name: BlueZ.ResultOfPairing
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the outcomes of pairing with remote devices. This helps us better understand the persentage of successful pairing against failures and the causes of failures.

histogram.name: BlueZ.TimeLengthOfAdvertisement
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the duration when the local device is performing Bluetooth advertisment and discoverable as a Bluetooth Low Energy device by other devices. This helps us better understand the amount of successful advertisment sessions and the duration.

histogram.name: BlueZ.TimeLengthOfDiscoverable
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the duration when the local device is discoverable by other devices as a Bluetooth classic device. This helps us better understand the amount of requests to expose the local device as a Bluetooth classic device and the duration.

histogram.name: BlueZ.TimeLengthOfDiscovering
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the duration for the local device to perform device discovery. This helps us better understand the amount of device discovery request and the duration for users to find the target device.

histogram.name: BlueZ.TimeLengthOfPairing
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the duration taken to finish a successful pairing between the local device and a remote Bluetooth device. This helps us better understand the latency of completing Bluetooth pairing.

histogram.name: BlueZ.TimeLengthOfSetupConnection
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the duration taken to finish a successful connection between the local device and a remote Bluetooth device. This helps us better understand the latency of connecting to a Bluetooth device.

histogram.name: BlueZ.TypeOfDiscovery
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the types of device discovery performed by the local device. This helps us better understand the most common type of device discovery performed.

histogram.name: BlueZ.TypeOfFoundDevice
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records the types of discovered devices in terms of Bluetooth classic, Bluetooth low energy and Dual-mode supports. This helps us better understand the persentage of Bluetooth devices in terms of type.

histogram.name: BookmarkManager.CommandExecuted
histogram.summary:
Logs when a user action triggers a command in the bookmark manager. Commands can be triggered by keyboard shortcuts, menu items or other buttons in the UI.
Revised in M-76 when the "Open (double click/enter)" bucket was split into two separate buckets, one for bookmarks and one for folders.
This histogram is of special interest to the chrome-analysis-team@. Do not change its semantics or retire it without talking to them first.

histogram.name: BookmarkManager.CommandMenuOpened
histogram.summary: Logs where the menu was opened from when a user action opens the command menu in the bookmark manager.

histogram.name: BookmarkManager.NumDragged
histogram.summary: Logs the number of bookmarks that were dragged simultaneously by a user.

histogram.name: BookmarkManager.ResultsRenderedTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to load the bookmarks Web UI and render. This is roughly equivalent to 'time to first meaningful paint' for the bookmark manager.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.AddedPerProfileType
histogram.summary:
This histogram records when a bookmark is added sliced on profile type.
This was not recorded for Android before M90. Reading list and partner bookmarks aren't reported by it.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.BookmarkAllTabsWithTabsCount.Incognito
histogram.summary: This histogram records the count of tabs when a user bookmarks all open tabs, in incognito mode.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.BookmarkAllTabsWithTabsCount.Regular
histogram.summary: This histogram records the count of tabs when a user bookmarks all open tabs, in regular mode.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.BookmarksBarStatus.OnReadingListOpened
histogram.summary: This records the Boomarks bar pref state and status when the reading list is opened. This will help determine how often the reading list is accessed from the NTP where the bookmarks bar is always visible and the bookmark bar pref state for those from the NTP. (Desktop only).

histogram.name: Bookmarks.BookmarksInFolder
histogram.summary: Logs the number of bookmark items inside a folder every time a folder is opened inside the bookmark manager.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.BottomSheet.DestinationFolder
histogram.summary: Logs the destination directory chosen by the user when saving a bookmark via bottom sheet on Android.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.Count.OnProfileLoad
histogram.summary: The total number of bookmarks a user has saved, excluding folders. Recorded when a profile is opened - precisely, when bookmarks are loaded into storage from disk. The count includes all bookmarks both in the "Bookmarks Bar" and also under "Other Bookmarks".

histogram.name: Bookmarks.Count.OnProfileLoad.DuplicateUrl
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Bookmarks.Count.OnProfileLoad.DuplicateUrl2 as of 11/2020 to provide more granular buckets above 10K duplicates
histogram.summary: The number of bookmarks a user has saved with a URL that is also present in at least one other bookmark. This excludes folders (which don't have a URL). Recorded when bookmarks are loaded into storage from disk if there is at least one duplicate.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.Count.OnProfileLoad.Duplicate{UniquenessCriterion}
histogram.summary: The number of bookmarks a user has saved with a {UniquenessCriterion} that is also present in at least one other bookmark. This excludes not only folders (which don't have a URL) but it also excludes one bookmark per unique {UniquenessCriterion} (that is, all except one are considered duplicates). Recorded when bookmarks are loaded into storage from disk if there is at least one duplicate.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.Count.OnProfileLoad.Unique{UniquenessCriterion}
histogram.summary: The number of unique {UniquenessCriterion}s among bookmarks saved by the user. Recorded when bookmarks are loaded into storage from disk.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.Count.OpenInIncognito
histogram.summary: Records the number of bookmarks which are opened using the "Open in incognito tab" button from selection mode in the Android bookmark manager.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.Count.OpenInNewTab
histogram.summary: Records the number of bookmarks which are opened using the "Open in new tab" button from selection mode in the Android bookmark manager.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.CreateBookmarkIndexTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to build the bookmark index. Logged upon profile load when the bookmarks JSON file is read.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.DecodeTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to decode the bookmarks JSON file. Logged upon profile load when the bookmarks JSON file is read.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.DuplicateAndEmptyTitleDetectionTime
histogram.summary: Time to compute values to be logged for UMA metrics Bookmarks.Count.OnProfileLoad.*.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.EntryPoint
histogram.summary: How users add a new bookmark.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.LaunchLocation
histogram.summary: Logs a UI location from which a bookmark is launched.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.OnFaviconsChangedIconURL
histogram.summary: Logs how frequently BookmarkModel::OnFaviconsChanged() is called with a non-empty |icon_url| to determine whether BookmarkNodes should be cached based on their favicon URLs (e.g. http://www.google.com/favicon.ico) in addition to their page URLs (e.g. http://www.google.com). OnFaviconChanged() is expected to be called less than 10 times per user per day with a non-empty |icon_url|.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.OpenBookmarkManager.PerProfileType
histogram.summary: This records the number of times the bookmark manager is opened from regular or Incognito tab. This histogram only records the count from ChromeTabbedActivity where we actually have the Bookmark manager UI. Recorded when the bookmark menu item is clicked in Android.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.OpenBookmarkTimeInterval.{BookmarkType}
histogram.summary: Logs the duration in milliseconds between bookmark creation time and bookmark open time based on device local time. Recorded when {BookmarkType} is opened. Bookmark folder is not considered. The creation and open can happen on different runs of Chrome.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.OpenBookmarkTimeInterval2.{BookmarkType}
histogram.summary: A new version of Bookmarks.OpenBookmarkTimeInterval.{BookmarkType}, to rule out corrupted data introduced by a timestamp bug.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.OpenBookmarkType
histogram.summary: Logs whether the bookmark entry is a user bookmark or a partner bookmark when it is opened.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.ReadingList.NumberOfItems
histogram.summary: Logs the total number of reading list items shown in the reading list on the Android Bookmarks page when it is opened.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.ReadingList.NumberOfReadItems
histogram.summary: Logs the number of read items shown in the reading list on the Android Bookmarks page when it is opened.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.ReadingList.NumberOfUnreadItems
histogram.summary: Logs the number of unread items shown in the reading list on the Android Bookmarks page when it is opened.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.StarEntryPoint.ClickedAction
histogram.summary: Recorded when an action in the Bookmark icon menu is clicked.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.UsageCountPerProfileType
histogram.summary: The number of times bookmarks are used in each profile type. Recorded when a bookmark is clicked.

histogram.name: BootTime.Total2
histogram.summary: Time from power on to login panel ready (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: BrotliFilter.CompressionPercent
histogram.summary: Compressed/Decompressed size ratio.

histogram.name: BrotliFilter.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: More detailed failure reason.

histogram.name: BrotliFilter.Status
histogram.summary: The final state of BrotliFilter.

histogram.name: BrotliFilter.UsedMemoryKB
histogram.summary: Maximal amount of memory allocated by decoder.

histogram.name: Canvas.TextMetrics.SetFont
histogram.summary:
Time spent in microseconds to perform calls to SetFont in Canvas for Canvas2d. It's measured each time SetFont is called.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.DetectionResultSincePortal
histogram.summary: Within one minute of the default network reporting a portal network, if we see an offline detection result, it is likely the client got blacklisted. Record the boolean rate that Chrome observes offline vs non-offline detection results. See go/bad-portal for client blacklisting problem.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.DetectResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of a captive portal probe.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.NetworkPortalDetectorResult
histogram.summary: Chrome captive portal detection results on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.NetworkPortalDetectorType
histogram.summary: Captive portal detection network type recorded when Chrome on Chrome OS detects a captive portal.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.NetworkStateResult
histogram.summary: Captive portal detection state from Shill received by NetworkState.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.NetworkStateStatusCode
histogram.summary: Captive portal status code reported by Shill and received by NetworkState.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.ProbeReason
histogram.summary: Reason for attempting a captive portal probe. This is logged only when a probe HTTP request is made. If there are multiple reasons that triggered this probe, only the first is logged.

histogram.name: Cast.Channel.Certificate
histogram.summary: Records the result of the Cast certificate verification on the Cast sender.

histogram.name: Cast.Channel.Nonce
histogram.summary: Records whether the correct nonce challenge was in the Cast receiver's response.

histogram.name: Cast.Channel.Signature
histogram.summary: Records whether the signature returned by the Cast receiver is verifiable with the challenge and device certificate.

histogram.name: Cast.Network.Down.Duration.In.Seconds
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the time the network has been down on a Cast device. Recorded when network goes up.

histogram.name: Cast.Network.Up.Duration.In.Minutes
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the time the network has been up on a Cast device. Recorded when network goes down.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastMediaType
histogram.summary: Records the media type of every video being cast.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastPlayerResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed September 2020 as it's no longer being collected.
histogram.summary: Records the result of a request to play remotely on a per player app basis within Chrome for Android.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastTimeRemainingPercentage
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2021/02 as it's not been collected for a while due to refactoring. A new metrics, "Cast.Sender.Clank.CastTimeRemainingPercentage" now collects the same data but at a different location.
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of the video left at the time the remote playback is stopped. This will be recorded when the playback is stopped by the user, or when it's stopped by the cast device.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.Clank.CastTimeRemainingPercentage
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of the video left at the time the remote playback is stopped. This will be recorded when the playback is stopped by the user, or when it's stopped by the cast device. To reduce the number of empty buckets, the result is rounded and a value of 1 means 10%.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.Clank.FullscreenControlsAction
histogram.summary: Record each interaction with the fullscreen remote playback controls on Clank.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.Clank.NotificationControlsAction
histogram.summary: Record each interaction with the cast notification controls on Clank.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.Clank.SessionTimeWithoutMediaElementPercentage
histogram.summary: Records the ratio of the time the media element was detached from the remote playback session to the total duration of the session (as from when the element has been attached till when the session stopped or disconnected). To reduce the number of empty buckets, the result is rounded and a value of 1 means 10%.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.DeviceType
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2021/02 as it's not been collected for a while due to refactoring.
histogram.summary: Records the type of the remote playback device selected by the user. This will be recorded when the user has chosen the device from the media route chooser dialog.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.FullscreenControlsActionWithMediaElement
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2021/02 as it's not been collected for a while due to refactoring.
histogram.summary: Record each interaction with the fullscreen remote playback controls in cases when the corresponding media element on the page was present.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.FullscreenControlsActionWithoutMediaElement
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2021/02 as it's not been collected for a while due to refactoring.
histogram.summary: Record each interaction with the fullscreen remote playback controls in cases when the corresponding media element on the page was not present.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.MediaElementPresentWhenShowFullscreenControls
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2021/02 as it's not been collected for a while due to refactoring.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the corresponding media element on the page was present when the fullscreen remote playback controls were shown.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.RemotePlayback.InitiationLocation
histogram.summary: Records where the user started RemotePlayback on Clank. This does not include RemotePlayback sessions initiated through the Cast SDK.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.SessionTimeWithoutMediaElementPercentage
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2021/02 as it's not been collected for a while due to refactoring. A new metrics, "Cast.Sender.Clank.SessionTimeWithoutMediaElementPercentage" now collects the same data but at a different location.
histogram.summary: Records the ratio of the time the media element was detached from the remote playback session to the total duration of the session (as from when the element has been attached till when the session stopped or disconnected), in percents.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.UrlResolveResult
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2021/02 as it's not been collected for a while due to refactoring.
histogram.summary: Records the result of resolving the video URL for cast, including checking its CORS header.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.VideoEncodeAcceleratorInitializeSuccess
histogram.summary: Indicates whether initialization of a video encode accelerator for Cast sender was successful.

histogram.name: CastV2.Transport.Connect.Latency.Unknown
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The latency between when a Cast V2 connection is established and the first message is received on that connection. "Unknown" is the peer type, which is not known at this point in the CastV2 connection establishment. Naming conforms to the CastV2 sender-side histogram naming convention "CastV2.[action].[name].[peer_type]".

histogram.name: CastV2.Transport.SslHandshake.Error.Unknown
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: On accepting a Cast V2 transport socket connection, if an error is encountered, the error code is logged here. "Unknown" is the peer type, which is not known at this point in the CastV2 connection establishment. "SslHandshake.Error" is the name of the action. Naming conforms to the CastV2 sender-side histogram naming convention "CastV2.[action].[name].[peer_type]".

histogram.name: CastV2.Transport.SslHandshake.Unknown
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time taken to do the handshake during Cast V2 transport socket creation. "Unknown" is the peer type, which is not known at this point in the CastV2 connection establishment. Naming conforms to the CastV2 sender-side histogram naming convention "CastV2.[action].[name].[peer_type]".

histogram.name: CertificateType2
histogram.summary: Information about the certificate algorithms and sizes in use on the web, to examine compliance with the CA/Browser Forum requirements and security best practice. This histogram considers the notBefore as the issuance date, for purposes of what requirements apply.

histogram.name: ChildAccountReconcilor.ForcedUserExitOnReconcileError
histogram.summary: Number of forced logouts for child accounts on an account reconciliation error. Check |ChromeOSChildAccountReconcilorDelegate|.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.BadMessgeTerminated
histogram.summary: Count of child processes killed because they sent an IPC that couldn't be deserialized.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Crashed.UtilityProcessExitCode
histogram.summary: Recorded when a crash occurs in a Utility process. On crash, the exit code will indicate the exception code of the crash.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Crashed.UtilityProcessHash
histogram.summary: Count of child utility process crashes, bucketed by the hash of their process name. The process name is typically the service name of the mojo service.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Crashed2
histogram.summary: Count of child process crashes grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Disconnected2
histogram.summary: Count of child process abnormal channel disconnects grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.DisconnectedAlive2
histogram.summary: Count of child process abnormal channel disconnects that are not classified and reported because we took the exit code too early. Grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.FieldTrials.CreateFromShmemSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether creating field trials from shared memory succeeded. Recorded by each child process on process startup.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.FieldTrials.CreateFromSwitchSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether creating field trials from --force-fieldtrials switch succeeded. Recorded by each child process on process startup.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.HungRendererAvailableMemoryMB
histogram.summary: The amount of avaiable memory when a renderer hangs. Recorded for every renderer hang.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.HungRendererInForeground
histogram.summary: Whether a renderer hang happened in the foreground or background. Recorded for every renderer hang on Android.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Killed2
histogram.summary: Count of child process kills grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Killed2.OOM
histogram.summary: Out of ChildProcess.Killled, number of kills due to SIGKILL, which is a strong signal of out of memory on Chrome OS, grouped by process type.

histogram.name: ChildProcess.KilledByExtensionAPI
histogram.summary: Count of child processes killed by the extension API (processes.terminate).

histogram.name: ChildProcess.Launched.UtilityProcessHash
histogram.summary: Count of child utility process launches, bucketed by the hash of their process name. The process name is typically the service name of the mojo service.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.BrowserLoadTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to load the native libraries in the browser process.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.RelroAvailableImmediately
histogram.summary: Recorded when RELRO is replaced with a shared memory region, in all processes consuming RELRO. Indicates whether the shared RELRO was available synchronously right after the native library was loaded. ModernLinker only.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.RelroProvidedSuccessfully
histogram.summary: Recorded when the native library is loaded by the Chromium linker, and an attempt to spawn a shared RELRO region is made. Indicates whether the attempt was a success. If the number of samples from "ChromiumAndroidLinker.RelroAvailableImmediately" where the availability was not immediate is large compared to the counts of successful RELRO spawns, it would indicate potential startup performance improvements when starting child process(es) during early browser startup phases. ModernLinker only.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.RelroSharingStatus
histogram.summary: Recorded when RELRO is replaced with a shared memory region, in all processes consuming RELRO. Indicates whether the replacement was a success. ModernLinker only.

histogram.name: ChromiumAndroidLinker.RendererLoadTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to load the native libraries in the renderer process.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Connections
histogram.summary: Recorded every time a Chromoting connection enters a new state.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Connections.Durations.Closed
histogram.summary: The duration of sessions that were closed, normally by a user-initiated action.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Connections.Durations.Failed
histogram.summary: The duration of sessions that failed to connect.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Connections.Times.ToAuthenticate
histogram.summary: The time taken to authenticate as part of a Chromoting connection request.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Connections.Times.ToConnect
histogram.summary: The time taken to connect to a remote-host, after a request has been authenticated.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Input.EventLatency
histogram.summary:
Input event delivery latency from the browser to the plugin.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.Bandwidth
histogram.summary: The bandwidth of non-empty packets in Chromoting remote sessions, updated every time a video packet is processed and logged every 1s.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.CaptureLatency
histogram.summary: The time to capture a video frame on the host, returned as part of a video packet.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.CaptureOverhead
histogram.summary: Amount of time wasted on IPC and threading overhead when capturing a video frame.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.CapturePendingLatency
histogram.summary: The time from when an input event is received to when the next frame is captured.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.DecodeLatency
histogram.summary: The time to decode a video packet on the client.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.EncodeLatency
histogram.summary: The time to encode a video packet on the host, returned as part of a video packet.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.EncodePendingLatency
histogram.summary: Delay before a newly captured frame is passed to the encoder.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.FrameRate
histogram.summary: The frame-rate of non-empty packets in Chromoting remote sessions, updated every time a video packet is processed and logged every 1s.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.NetworkLatency
histogram.summary: Estimated network roundtrip latency calculated by subtracting total processing time on host and client from the total roundtrip time.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.PacketRate
histogram.summary: The packets/sec, including empty packets, in Chromoting remote sessions, updated every time a video packet is processed and logged every 1s.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.PaintLatency
histogram.summary: The time to paint a decoded video packet on the client.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.RoundTripLatency
histogram.summary: The time from an input being sent from the client to a response being received by the client after it is processed by the host.

histogram.name: Chromoting.Video.SendPendingLatency
histogram.summary: Delay before an encoded video packet is written to the send buffer.

histogram.name: clickjacking.save_download
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The length of time between a dangerous download appearing on the download shelf, and the "Keep" button being clicked.

histogram.name: ClientHints.CriticalCHRestart
histogram.summary: Count of requests restarted because of the Critical-CH response header.

histogram.name: ClientHints.PersistDuration
histogram.summary: Duration for which the origin requested the client hints to be persisted. Collected on the renderer side.

histogram.name: ClientHints.UpdateEventCount
histogram.summary: Count of events when the client hints needs to be persisted to the disk by the browser.

histogram.name: ClientHints.UpdateSize
histogram.summary: Count of client hints that need to be persisted to the disk. Recorded by the renderer.

histogram.name: Clipboard.ExtensionContentScriptReadHasUserActivation
histogram.obsolete: Removed February 2021 as enough data was collected.
histogram.summary: For calls to document.execCommand('paste') by extensions via content scripts, record the proportion of calls with user activation.

histogram.name: Clipboard.Read
histogram.summary: Counts how often each Clipboard format is read by the platform clipboard. These reads generally imply that an application requested this format after checking that the format is available, but there are some cases where Chrome reads a format to check for existence (outside the ui::Clipboard::ReadAvailableTypes() function). Please prefer interpreting these numbers as relative use changes, as opposed to absolute user usage.

histogram.name: Clipboard.RegisterClipboardFormatFailure
histogram.summary: Counts how often the Windows clipboard fails to register a format. Recorded when RegisterClipbaordFormat fails (returns 0). Failure rates will inform whether we implement error handling. https://crbug.com/1000919

histogram.name: Clipboard.Write
histogram.summary: Counts how often each Clipboard format is written by the platform clipboard. These writes all imply that an application had this format available, and therefore wrote this format.

histogram.name: Clipboard.X11StoreCopyPasteDuration
histogram.summary: The length of time that it takes to transfer ownership of Chrome's CLIPBOARD selection to the clipboard manager when Chrome exits.

histogram.name: ComponentUpdater.Calls
histogram.summary: The number of times the component updater called UpdateClient::Install or UpdateClient::Update. These correspond to the number of manual component update checks performed as a result of a user action, and the number of automated component update checks.

histogram.name: ComponentUpdater.ChromeOS.InstallResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS only. Installation error code in CrosComponentManager.

histogram.name: ComponentUpdater.ChromeOS.MountTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS only. Time it takes to mount a component image.

histogram.name: ComponentUpdater.UpdateCompleteError
histogram.summary: The result of an install or an update check.

histogram.name: ComponentUpdater.UpdateCompleteResult
histogram.summary: The result of an install or an update check.

histogram.name: ComponentUpdater.UpdateCompleteTime
histogram.summary: Time to complete an Install or an Update component update call.

histogram.name: CompositorLatency
histogram.summary:
Tracks the duration of various stages in the pipeline as a single frame goes through the various stages in the compositor. This is reported for frames that went through all the compositor stages in chromium, and was presented to the user.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: CompositorLatency.CompositorOnlyFrame
histogram.summary:
Tracks the duration of various stages in the pipeline as a single frame goes through the various stages in the compositor in the cases that there is no damage from main thread.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: CompositorLatency.Diagnostic.PresentationTimeDeltaFromDeadline
histogram.summary: For the compositor pipeline, measures how far the presentation time of a compositor frame is from the frame deadline (i.e. vsync time).

histogram.name: CompositorLatency.DroppedFrame
histogram.summary:
Tracks the duration of various stages in the pipeline as a single frame goes through the various stages in the compositor. This is reported for frames that the user did not see: this includes frames that are dropped in various stages inside chromium, or even frames that went through all stages in chromium, but ultimately was not presented to the user.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: CompositorLatency.MissedDeadlineFrame
histogram.summary:
Tracks the duration of various stages in the pipeline as a single frame goes through the various stages in the compositor. This is reported for frames that went through all the compositor stages in chromium, and was presented to the user, but were delayed and missed their deadline.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: CompositorLatency.Type
histogram.summary: Whether frame is dropped or presented meeting or missing the deadline or is a compositor only frame.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.External.Modeset.AttemptSucceeded
histogram.summary: Modeset attempt result of an external display. Every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of the external screen is changed by the user, Chrome attempts to modeset the display. This metric tracks the result of those attempts. Resolution and RefreshRate metrics will be recorded for each attempt.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.External.Modeset.FinalStatus
histogram.summary: Modeset attempt result of an internal display. This is recorded after Chrome attempted all the available modes and finally modeset the display. All the previously attempted modes and refreshes, including the successful one will be recorded.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.External.Modeset.RefreshRate
histogram.summary: Refresh rate of the mode for the display we're about to modeset. This is recorded every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of the external screen is about to change.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.External.Modeset.Resolution
histogram.summary: DisplayResolution of the mode for the external display we're about to modeset. 0 means the display was powered off. This is recorded every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of the external screen is about to change.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Internal.Modeset.AttemptSucceeded
histogram.summary: Modeset attempt result of an internal display. Chrome might try additional modes after a failed attempt. Every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of the external screen is changed by the user, Chrome attempts to modeset the display. This metric tracks the result of those attempts. Resolution and RefreshRate metrics will be recorded for each attempt.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Internal.Modeset.FinalStatus
histogram.summary: Modeset attempt result of an internal display. This is recorded after Chrome attempted all the available modes and finally modeset the display. All the previously attempted modes and refreshes, including the successful one will be recorded.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Internal.Modeset.RefreshRate
histogram.summary: Refresh rate of the mode for the display we're about to modeset. This is recorded every time the internal display is powered on/off, or when an external monitor is plugged in.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Internal.Modeset.Resolution
histogram.summary: DisplayResolution of the mode for the internal display we're about to modeset. 0 means the display was powered off. This is recorded every time the internal display is powered on/off, or when an external monitor is plugged in.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Modeset.MstExternalDisplaysCount
histogram.summary: Total number of external displays connected via MST and being configured. This is recorded every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of a screen is about to change.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Modeset.MstExternalDisplaysPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of external displays connected via MST and being configured. This is recorded every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of a screen is about to change.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Modeset.TotalExternalDisplaysCount
histogram.summary: Total number of external displays being configured. This is recorded every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of a screen is about to change.

histogram.name: Conflicts.ConfirmedBadModules
histogram.summary: The number of confirmed bad modules found during module enumeration.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerateLoadedModules
histogram.summary: The length of time it takes to enumerate the loaded modules in the browser process.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerateShellExtensions
histogram.summary: The length of time it takes to enumerate the shell extensions.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerateWinsockModules
histogram.summary: The length of time it takes to enumerate the Winsock LSP modules.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerationInspectionTime
histogram.summary: The cumulative length of time it takes to inspect all modules on disk, extracting their certificates and version information. This work is actually spread out over a much longer period of time so as not to impact the user.

histogram.name: Conflicts.EnumerationTotalTime
histogram.summary: The cumulative length of time it takes to enumerate and inspect all modules. This work is actually spread out over a much longer period of time so as not to impact the user.

histogram.name: Conflicts.SuspectedBadModules
histogram.summary: The number of suspected bad modules found during module enumeration.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.ChromeOsSignalStrength
histogram.summary: Connectivity Diagnostics App: WiFi signal strength recorded during NIC_SIGNAL_STRENGTH test.
histogram.details: The "Strength" property of a WiFi signal is a partially-reversible function that linearly maps the RSSI range -120dBm to -20dBm to Strength values from 0 to 100.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.RESOLVER_LATENCY
histogram.summary: Resolution latency seen by the Connectivity Diagnostics.
histogram.details: Resolver latency is computed by using the chrome.dns API to query three randomly generated Google hostnames (*-ccd-testing-v4.metric.gstatic.com). The random hostnames guarantees that there will be no caching of DNS hostnames. The time taken from issuing the DNS request to receiving a response is clocked in JavaScript and the arithmetic mean of the three times is used as the resolver latency.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.CancelSystemTouches
histogram.summary: Logs true when the system touches are cancelled in order to show the Context Menu instead of performing a default system action. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.DelayedElementDetails
histogram.summary: Logged when DOM element details are not yet available when the user completes a long press. Also logs if the context menu was shown once the element details became available or if the display was cancelled. This ensures that all context menu gestures are eventually processed. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.DOMElementFrame
histogram.summary: Logged when the Context Menu will be displayed. Also logs if the element for the last touch was found in the main frame or a iframe. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.iOS.CopyImage
histogram.summary: Logged when the copying image from context menu is invoked and relevant events happen during the copying image procedure.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.iOS.GetImageDataByJsResult
histogram.summary: Result of getting image data by JavaScript for CopyImage, SaveImage and SearchByImage from iOS context menu. Recorded when the JavaScript returns, or fails for timeout.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.LensChip.Event
histogram.summary: Logged when the Lens chip is shown and relevant events when the user interacts with the Lens chip. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.LensSupportStatus
histogram.summary: Whether the user supports the Lens intent and if not, the reason why. Recorded only if the feature is enabled when the long-press context menu is shown for an image.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.SaveLinkType
histogram.summary: Type of the url when user saves the content through the save link context menu.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.SelectedOptionAndroid
histogram.summary:
The option that the user selected from a context menu on Android. This is logged on Android only; check out ContextMenu.SelectedOptionIOS for iOS, and ContextMenu.SelectedOptionDesktop for desktop. Note that if a menu is invoked on mixed content, only one of the submetrics receives the log; read the code to determine which one.
This histogram is of special interest to the chrome-analysis-team@. Do not change its semantics or retire it without talking to them first.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.SelectedOptionDesktop
histogram.summary: The option that the user selected from a context menu on desktop. This is logged on desktop only; check out ContextMenu.SelectedOptionIOS for iOS, and ContextMenu.SelectedOptionAndroid for Android. Note that if a menu is invoked on mixed content, only one of the submetrics receives the log; read the code to determine which one.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.SelectedOptionIOS
histogram.summary:
The option that the user selected from a context menu on iOS. This is logged on iOS only; check out ContextMenu.SelectedOptionAndroid for Android, and ContextMenu.SelectedOptionDesktop for desktop. Note that if a menu is invoked on mixed content, only one of the submetrics receives the log; read the code to determine which one.
This histogram is of special interest to the chrome-analysis-team@. Do not change its semantics or retire it without talking to them first.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.Shown
histogram.summary: Recorded when a context menu is shown, sliced by whether a web contents was present. (It generally should be; indeed, this code path should not be followed when it is absent. For instance, invoking a context menu from the new tab page or from the sad tab page will not cause an emission to this histogram.) Note that this refers to link context menus, not the cut-copy-paste context menus that can appear during long presses on text on a web page or long presses in the omnibox. This is an Android-only metric; compare with RenderViewContextMenu.Shown and RenderViewContextMenu.Used on desktop.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.ThumbnailFetched
histogram.summary: Logged when the callback to fetch the thumbnail returns a result: Success (bitmap data received) or Failure (null bitmap). Android only.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.TimeToSelectShare
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes to press on "Share" from the time context menu is shown. Android only.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.TimeToTakeAction.Abandoned
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the user to abandon the context menu after it's shown by pressing back or touching outside the menu. This is only logged if the menu is abandoned. See ContextMenu.TimeToTakeAction.SelectedItem for the cases where it is closed as a result of user interaction with the menu. Android only.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.TimeToTakeAction.SelectedItem
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the user to select an item. This is only logged if the menu is closed as a result of the user clicking a menu item or a DirectShare button. See ContextMenu.TimeToTakeAction.Abandoned for the cases where it is abandoned by the user. Android only.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.URLClicked
histogram.summary: Logged when the URL is clicked. Android only.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.ViewsTextServices.Emoji
histogram.summary: Number of times the emoji item in the views text services context menu is used.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.WaitingForElementDetails
histogram.summary: Logs true when the context menu gesture recognizer fully recognizes a long press, but is still waiting on the DOM element details before the context menu can be shown. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: Conversions.ClearDataTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to clear conversion data. Logged any time site data is cleared in Chrome.

histogram.name: Conversions.ExtraReportDelay
histogram.summary: Records the "extra" non-scheduled time it took to send a particular conversion report. This is primarily due to a report's scheduled report time taking place while the browser is closed. Recorded when a conversion report is sent.

histogram.name: Conversions.ImpressionNavigationHasDeadInitiator
histogram.summary: Measures how often impressions are ignored because the initiator frame is dead by the time the navigation reaches the browser.

histogram.name: Conversions.RegisteredConversionsPerPage
histogram.summary: Records the number of registered conversions (https://github.com/WICG/conversion-measurement-api) on a given top level page load. Recorded when the page navigates away or is otherwise closed. Only recorded for non-off-the-record profiles (OTR profiles have the feature disabled).

histogram.name: Conversions.RegisteredImpressionsPerPage
histogram.summary: Records the number of impressions attempted on a given top level page load. Recorded when the page navigates away or is otherwise closed. Only recorded for non-off-the-record profiles (OTR profiles have the feature disabled).

histogram.name: Conversions.ReportRetrySucceed
histogram.summary: Records whether a particular conversion report was successful. Emitted for all conversion reports which retry.

histogram.name: Conversions.ReportStatus
histogram.summary: Records the high level request status of a conversion report. Recorded for every conversion report sent.

histogram.name: Conversions.Storage.ClearDataWithFilterDuration
histogram.summary: Records the time it took to do perform a clear operation on the database when supplied an origin filter. Recorded when the conversion database finishes performing a clear operation. Note that filters may vary in size and computation complexity, skewing this metric aribtrarily.

histogram.name: Conversions.Storage.CreationTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it took to initialize a new conversions database from scratch. Recorded when the conversion database finishes initialization.

histogram.name: Conversions.Storage.MigrationTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it took to migrate a preexisting conversions database to the latest schema. Recorded when the conversion database finishes initialization.

histogram.name: Conversions.Storage.Sql.InitStatus
histogram.summary: Records initialisation statuses of ConversionStorageSql. Note: currently ConversionStorageSql is initialised lazily.

histogram.name: Conversions.TimeFromConversionToReportSend
histogram.summary: Records the time between a conversion and its reporting. This is emitted whenever a conversion report is sent.

histogram.name: CopylessPaste.CacheHit
histogram.summary: The cache hit status of metadata extraction for AppIndexing.
