histogram.summary: This histogram records the dirty span of the transition animation between Tab and Grid Tab Switcher. The dirty span is the duration from the start of the animation to the last View invalidation.

histogram.name: GridTabSwitcher.FramePerSecond
histogram.summary: This histogram records the frame rate of the transition animation between Tab and Grid Tab Switcher.

histogram.name: GridTabSwitcher.MaxFrameInterval
histogram.summary: This histogram records the maximum interval between rendered frames during the transition animation between Tab and Grid Tab Switcher.

histogram.name: GridTabSwitcher.ThumbnailFetchingResult
histogram.summary: This histogram records the result of thumbnail fetching in the Grid Tab Switcher.

histogram.name: GwpAsan.CrashAnalysisResult
histogram.summary:
Reports the GWP-ASan crash analysis result. That can either be a determination that the crash was related to GWP-ASan, not related to GWP-ASan, or an error making that determination. Recorded with every crash.
Deprecated in favor of GwpAsan.CrashAnalysisResult.Malloc and GwpAsan.CrashAnalysisResult.PartitionAlloc in M76

histogram.name: Hardware.Concurrency
histogram.summary: Records the system hardware concurrency collected in the info collection GPU process, once per UMA ping. For most systems, it is equivalent to the number of CPU cores.

histogram.name: Hardware.Display.Count.OnChange
histogram.summary: The number of displays present right after the user has attached or detached a new display. Excludes mirrored displays, but includes sleeping displays.

histogram.name: Hardware.Display.Count.OnStartup
histogram.summary: The number of displays present at start up. Excludes mirrored displays, but includes sleeping displays.

histogram.name: Hardware.TotalDiskSpace
histogram.summary: Records a rough estimation of the system total disk space collected in the info collection GPU process, once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: HeapProfiling.ProfiledProcess.Type
histogram.summary: One metric is emitted every 24-hours after Chrome is launched for every process that is being profiled. The timer is reset if Chrome exits.

histogram.name: HeapProfiling.ProfilingMode
histogram.summary: One metric is emitted every 24-hours after Chrome is launched for every Chrome instance that is using out of process heap profiling. The timer is reset if Chrome exits.

histogram.name: HeapProfiling.RecordTrace.Success
histogram.summary: The metric is emitted each time Chrome attempts to record a memory-infra trace to upload an out-of-process heap-profiling memory dump.

histogram.name: HeapProfiling.UploadTrace.Size
histogram.summary: The metric is emitted each time Chrome uploads a trace. It reflects the uncompressed size of the trace.

histogram.name: HeapProfiling.UploadTrace.Success
histogram.summary: The metric is emitted each time Chrome uploads a trace. It reflects whether the upload was successful.

histogram.name: HIDDetection.OOBEDevicesDetectedOnContinuePressed
histogram.summary: Which HID were detected when user pressed Continue on OOBE dialog. This metric is specific to Chrome OS.

histogram.name: HIDDetection.OOBEDialogShown
histogram.summary: Whether HID detection dialog was shown on OOBE. Logged on screen show or on screen skip respectively. This metric is specific to Chrome OS.

histogram.name: HIDDetection.TimesDialogShownPerOOBECompleted
histogram.summary: Records number of times the dialog was shown by the time OOBE is completed. This metric is specific to Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Histogram.BadConstructionArguments
histogram.summary: The hash codes of histograms that were found to have bad construction arguments. These would be DCHECK exceptions in debug builds but have simply been logged and corrected as best as possible rather than crash.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistentSnapshotBrowser
histogram.summary: The amount of discrepancy found when examining a single histogram's data in the browser process for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistentSnapshotChildProcess
histogram.summary: The amount of discrepancy found when examining a single histogram's data in a child process for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA.

histogram.name: Histogram.MismatchedConstructionArguments
histogram.summary: The hash codes of histograms that were found to have construction arguments different from a previous instantiation of the same name. Entries here have conflicting definitions and should be investigated. Data collected for the secondary definitions will be silently dropped.

histogram.name: Histogram.PendingProcessNotResponding
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When metrics services (UMA) ran an update, the number of child processes that did not respond, providing histogram updates, before the timeout.

histogram.name: Histogram.PermanentNameChanged
histogram.summary: The hash codes of histograms of which the external name storage was altered after the histogram was created.

histogram.name: Histogram.ReceivedProcessGroupCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When metrics services (UMA) ran an update, the number of times the process groups (renderer processes and plugin/gpu processes) did not respond, providing histogram updates, before the timeout.

histogram.name: Histogram.TooManyBuckets.1000
histogram.summary: The hash codes of histograms that were found to request more than 1000 buckets. These would be DCHECK exceptions in debug builds if the limit is lowered so are being logged before that change.

histogram.name: HostedAppFrame.ContentSettings.ImagePressed
histogram.summary: Counts which content setting buttons in the hosted app frame are pressed by the user.

histogram.name: HostedAppFrame.WrenchMenu.MenuAction
histogram.summary: Number of times that each menu item is clicked from the hosted app window menu button.

histogram.name: HttpCache.AccessToDone
histogram.summary: For every http cache transaction with a pattern (see HttpCache.Pattern), the time from the first access to the disk cache until the transaction was done.

histogram.name: HttpCache.AfterSend
histogram.summary: For http cache transactions in which a network request was sent, the time elapsed between sending it over the network until the transaction was done.

histogram.name: HttpCache.BeforeSend
histogram.summary: For http cache transactions in which a network request was sent, the time elapsed between beginning the request and sending it over the network; this is the time spent accessing the disk cache.

histogram.name: HttpCache.CantConditionalizeCause
histogram.summary: For each request that results in an unconditionalizable network request, the cause for the request.

histogram.name: HttpCache.CantConditionalizeZeroFreshnessFromMemHint
histogram.summary: For each request with HttpCache.CantConditionalizeCause == Zero Freshness, this is true iff the zero freshness status was determined by looking at in-memory hints in disk cache index, rather than by opening the entry and looking at headers.

histogram.name: HttpCache.EntryLockWait
histogram.summary: The time spent waiting for write lock on a disk cache entry.

histogram.name: HttpCache.HardReset
histogram.summary: Whether the HttpCache was forced to reset upon creation, effectively clearing out its previous content. This is recorded when the cache is created for the browsing session.

histogram.name: HttpCache.MaxFileSizeOnInit
histogram.summary: Max file size allowed to be cached in the http cache. This is logged at the time the backend is created.

histogram.name: HttpCache.NetworkIsolationKeyPresent2
histogram.summary: Records whether a cache request has a network isolation key set or not, which is used for double-keying.

histogram.name: HttpCache.ParallelWritingPattern
histogram.summary: Records whether a transaction either created a Writers object when one didn't exist, or joined an existing Writers object, or why it failed to do so (e.g., it's a range request, it's not a GET request, etc.).

histogram.name: HttpCache.Pattern
histogram.summary: For each http cache transaction, the recorded pattern.

histogram.name: HttpCache.ReadErrorNonRestartable
histogram.summary: Net error results from non-restartable cache read errors.

histogram.name: HttpCache.ReadErrorRestartable
histogram.summary: Net error results from restartable cache read errors.

histogram.name: HttpCache.ValidationCause
histogram.summary: For each validation attempt, the cause for the validation.

histogram.name: Hwsec.Attestation.Status
histogram.summary: The result of attestation-related operations on the Chrome OS side.

histogram.name: Hyphenation.Open
histogram.summary: The time it takes to open a hyphenation dictionary.

histogram.name: Hyphenation.Open.File
histogram.summary: The time it takes to open a hyphenation dictionary file.

histogram.name: ICU.CreateInstance
histogram.summary: This metric logs the creation of key ICU objects. These object creation called directly from Chrome code or indirectly from depending library such as blink and v8.

histogram.name: ICU.DataFile
histogram.summary: This metric logs the ICU built-in data file name opened and used by chrome. These file open calls are perform internally inside ICU while Chrome directly or indirectly call ICU to create object and cause ICU to load new data files, such as loading codeset conversion table, create break iterator, and open dictionary files for word break/line break iterator. It however does not include the opening of resource bundle files.

histogram.name: Import.ImportedHistorySize.AutoImportFromIE
histogram.summary: The size of the history on Auto Import from IE. This measure is only logged on a succesfull Auto Import.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.AutoImport
histogram.summary: The importer used on first run Auto Import.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.BookmarksAPI
histogram.summary: The importer used on import from the bookmarks file API.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.ImportDataHandler
histogram.summary: The importer used on import from the chrome://settings/importData UI.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.DeleteOnCloseError
histogram.summary: File error on Windows when ImportantFileWriter fails to mark the temporary file for deletion upon closure.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.FileCreateError
histogram.summary: File error happened upon temporary file creation at ImportantFileWriter.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.FileDeleteNoRetryError
histogram.summary: File error happened upon temporary file deletion at ImportantFileWriter when it was not possible to retry in a delayed task.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.FileDeleteRetryExceededError
histogram.summary: The final file error when all retries for deleting the temorary file fail.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.FileDeleteRetrySuccessCount
histogram.summary: The number of retries needed to successfully delete the temporary file. Only recorded when at least one retry (two attempts) is needed.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.FileRenameError
histogram.summary: File error happened upon temporary file renaming at ImportantFileWriter.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.FileReplaceRetryCount
histogram.summary: The number of retries needed to successfully move the temporary file to its final location. Zero means that ReplaceFile worked the first time. Ten means that it never succeeded.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.FileWriteError
histogram.summary: File error happened upon writing data to temporary file at ImportantFileWriter.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.SerializationDuration
histogram.summary: CPU time used in the foreground thread (usually UI thread) to serialize the data to be written into an important file (e.g. serialize JSON string for preferences). For users of ImportantFileWriter that leverage background serialization (e.g. bookmarks), it excludes the time spent on the background thread, and only logs the time spent on the foreground thread.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.TempFileFailures
histogram.summary: Count of various failures in ImportantFileWrite when manipulating a temp file to write to before moving it into place (replacing another file).

histogram.name: IncognitoModePrefs.WindowsParentalControlsInitThread
histogram.summary: The thread used to initialize the Windows parental controls.

histogram.name: IncognitoModePrefs.WindowsParentalControlsInitTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during a run of PlatformParentalControlsValue::IsParentalControlActivityLoggingOnImpl on Windows 7 and above.

histogram.name: IncompatibleApplicationsPage.AddedPostCrash
histogram.summary: Records whether the user was automatically shown the chrome://settings/incompatibleApplications page following a Chrome crash.

histogram.name: IncompatibleApplicationsPage.NumApplications
histogram.summary: The number of incompatible applications detected by Chrome at the time the chrome://settings/incompatibleApplications page was opened.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.AccelerometerAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_LINEAR_ACCELERATION was available at the start of Device Motion.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.AccelerometerIncGravityAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_ACCELEROMETER was available at the start of Device Motion.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.AccelerometerWindowsAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the SENSOR_TYPE_ACCELEROMETER_3D was available at the start of Device Motion on the Windows platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.DeviceOrientationSensorAndroid
histogram.summary: Provides a histogram of the base sensors (if any) that are used at the start of the Device Orientation API. Currently Sensor.TYPE_GAME_ROTATION_VECTOR is the default sensor for orientation, if it's not available fall-back options are provided by using either Sensor.TYPE_ROTATION_VECTOR or a combination of Sensor.TYPE_ACCELEROMETER and Sensor.TYPE_MAGNETIC_FIELD.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.GyrometerWindowsAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the SENSOR_TYPE_GYROMETER_3D was available at the start of Device Motion on the Windows platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.GyroscopeAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_GYROSCOPE was available at the start of Device Motion.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.InclinometerWindowsAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the SENSOR_TYPE_INCLINOMETER_3D was available at the start of Device Orientation on the Windows platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.MotionDefaultAvailable
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of Device Motion API invocations in the default implementation (Linux and CrOS). The default implementation does not provide any sensors so the result is always false.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.MotionMacAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the sudden motion sensor was available at the start of Device Motion on the MacOS platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.OrientationDefaultAvailable
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of Device Orientation API invocations in the default implementation (Linux and CrOS). The default implementation does not provide any sensors so the result is always false.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.OrientationMacAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the sudden motion sensor was available at the start of Device Orientation on the MacOS platform.

histogram.name: InfoBar.Shown
histogram.summary: Records how many times a particular infobar was shown to the user. On Android, the infobar may be partially hidden due to stacking. On desktop, a tab with a visible infobar will increment this histogram every time the user switches away from the tab and back to it with the infobar still visible.

histogram.name: InfoBar.Shown.Hidden
histogram.summary: Records how many times a particular infobar was displayed in a hidden state due to at least one other infobar existing. If there are no existing infobars, but the user scrolls at the exact moment a new infobar is added, the infobar may be hidden, but not recorded in this metric. Reliably triggering and detecting this combination is tricky so it isn't done. Only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: InfoBar.Shown.Hiding
histogram.summary: Records how many times a particular infobar was visible and hiding a new infobar behind it. Only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: InfoBar.Shown.Visible
histogram.summary: Records how many times a particular infobar was displayed in a visible state due to no other infobars existing. If there are no existing infobars, but the user scrolls at the exact moment a new infobar is added, the infobar may be hidden, but recorded here as visible. Reliably triggering and detecting this combination is tricky so it isn't done. Only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: InProductHelp.Config.ParsingEvent
histogram.summary: Records if in-product help configuration is parsed correctly, and the failure reasons for parsing failures.

histogram.name: InProductHelp.Db.Init
histogram.summary: Records if database initialization succeeds for in-product help.

histogram.name: InProductHelp.Db.Load
histogram.summary: Records if database successfully loads the data for in-product help.

histogram.name: InProductHelp.Db.TotalEvents
histogram.summary: Records the total number of event records in the database for in-product help after the event model is loaded.

histogram.name: InProductHelp.Db.Update
histogram.summary: Records if each database update succeeds for in-product help.

histogram.name: InProductHelp.NotifyEventReadyState
histogram.summary: Records if the model is ready when in-product help event happens.

histogram.name: InProductHelp.Promos.IPH_ReopenTab.DismissedAt
histogram.summary: Last step of in-product help (IPH) for reopening tabs that user followed before finishing the IPH flow or dismissing it early. Recorded when the IPH flow is dismissed, which is at one of three possible times: when the promo bubble times out, when the menu is closed after the user opens it for IPH, or when the user opens the last closed tab. The last is considered a success.

histogram.name: InProductHelp.Promos.Snooze
histogram.summary: Record the number of first-time snoozes and repeating snoozes of an in-product help bubble when the user clicks the snooze button. An snooze of an IPH that has been snoozed before is a repeating snooze.

histogram.name: InProductHelp.Promos.SnoozeCountAtAcknowledge
histogram.summary: Record the number of previous snoozes when an in-product help bubble is dismissed because the acknowledge button is clicked.

histogram.name: InProductHelp.Promos.SnoozeCountAtFollow
histogram.summary: Record the number of previous snoozes when an in-product help bubble is dismissed because the user follows the promo, e.g. a relevant control is clicked.

histogram.name: InProductHelp.Promos.SnoozeCountAtTrigger
histogram.summary: Record the number of previous snoozes when an in-product help bubble is triggered.

histogram.name: InProductHelp.ShouldTriggerHelpUI
histogram.summary: Records if in-product help is shown to the user, and the failure reasons if in-product help is not shown. Recorded on its own across all in-product help features, in addition to being a base name for feature-specific histograms.

histogram.name: InstanceID.DeleteToken.RequestStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of the outcome of DeleteToken request.

histogram.name: InstanceID.GetToken.CompleteTime
histogram.summary: Length of time taken to complete the GetToken request successfully. If the request is retried multiple times, the length of time is counted for the last successful retry.

histogram.name: InstanceID.GetToken.NetErrorCode
histogram.summary: Net error code from an Instance ID GetToken attempt. Recorded when URL loading completes.

histogram.name: InstanceID.GetToken.OptionsCount
histogram.summary: The number of options provided to the GetToken request. Recorded when the request has been received by the InstanceID instance.

histogram.name: InstanceID.GetToken.RequestStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of the outcome of GetToken request.

histogram.name: InstanceID.RestoredIDCount
histogram.summary: Number of Instance IDs restored from the persistent store at startup.

histogram.name: InstanceID.RestoredTokenCount
histogram.summary: Number of InstanceID tokens restored from the persistent store at startup.

histogram.name: Invalidations.GCMUpstreamRequest
histogram.summary: Status of sending outgoing invalidation message through GCM upsteam.

histogram.name: IPC.AttachmentBrokerPrivileged.BrokerAttachmentError
histogram.summary: Errors that the privileged attachment broker encounters while trying to broker attachments.

histogram.name: IPC.AttachmentBrokerUnprivileged.BrokerAttachmentError
histogram.summary: Errors that an unprivileged attachment broker encounters while trying to broker attachments.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.OnBeforeUnloadStayVsLeave
histogram.summary: For onbeforeunload dialogs, the user's choice between staying on the page and leaving it.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.OriginRelationship
histogram.summary: For dialogs, the relationship of the origins of the main frame vs the alerting frame.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.Scheme
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL showing a JavaScript dialog.

histogram.name: Kerberos.AcquireKerberosTgtTime
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds to acquire a Kerberos ticket. The value is recorded no matter if the operation was successful or not.

histogram.name: Kerberos.DailyActiveUsers
histogram.summary: Type of the Chrome OS login user (primary user) who requests Kerberos tickets. Reported at most once a day by the Kerberos daemon when a Kebreros ticket is acquired or Kerberos files are requested, which happens e.g. on Chrome startup.

histogram.name: Kerberos.EncryptionTypesAcquireKerberosTgt
histogram.summary: The Kerberos encryption types used while succesfully creating or refreshing a Kerberos TGT. This value is derived from the Kerberos configuration 'enctypes' fields.

histogram.name: Kerberos.NumberOfAccounts.Managed
histogram.summary: Number of managed Kerberos accounts owned by the current Chrome OS user. A managed account is an account that got added via the KerberosAccounts policy. Reported at most once a day similar to Kerberos.DailyActiveUsers.

histogram.name: Kerberos.NumberOfAccounts.RememberedPassword
histogram.summary: Number of Kerberos accounts owned by the current Chrome OS user that use the 'Remember password' feature, i.e. the account password is stored by the Kerberos daemon. Reported at most once a day similar to Kerberos.DailyActiveUsers.

histogram.name: Kerberos.NumberOfAccounts.Total
histogram.summary: Total number of Kerberos accounts owned by the current Chrome OS user. Reported at most once a day similar to Kerberos.DailyActiveUsers.

histogram.name: Kerberos.NumberOfAccounts.Unmanaged
histogram.summary: Number of unmanaged Kerberos accounts owned by the current Chrome OS user. An unmanaged account is an account that was added manually by the user. Reported at most once a day similar to Kerberos.DailyActiveUsers.

histogram.name: Kerberos.NumberOfAccounts.UseLoginPassword
histogram.summary: Number of Kerberos accounts owned by the current Chrome OS user that use the login password for authentication. These accounts were added via the KerberosAccounts policy, using the '${PASSWORD}' placeholder as password. Reported at most once a day similar to Kerberos.DailyActiveUsers.

histogram.name: Kerberos.Result.AcquireKerberosTgt
histogram.summary: Result from an attempt to acquire a Kerberos ticket. This happens whenever a new ticket is added or an existing ticket is reauthenticated.

histogram.name: Kerberos.Result.AddAccount
histogram.summary: Result from an attempt to add a new Kerberos account, either through the Kerberos Tickets settings page or via the KerberosAccounts policy.

histogram.name: Kerberos.Result.ClearAccounts
histogram.summary: Result from an attempt to clear Kerberos accounts, usually through toggling Kerberos related policies. For instance, disabling the KerberosEnabled policy clears all accounts.

histogram.name: Kerberos.Result.GetKerberosFiles
histogram.summary: Result from an attempt to retrieve a Kerberos ticket from the Kerberos daemon. Systems using Kerberos (Chrome, SMB file shares) perform this action during startup and when they get notified that the files changed.

histogram.name: Kerberos.Result.ListAccounts
histogram.summary: Result from an attempt to list Kerberos accounts, usually through opening the Kerberos Tickets settings page or making changes to accounts.

histogram.name: Kerberos.Result.RemoveAccount
histogram.summary: Result from an attempt to remove a new Kerberos account through the Kerberos Tickets settings page.

histogram.name: Kerberos.Result.SetConfig
histogram.summary: Result from an attempt to set Kerberos configuration. This happens right before acquiring a Kerberos ticket.

histogram.name: Kerberos.Result.ValidateConfig
histogram.summary: Result from an attempt to validate Kerberos configuration. This happens when the user tries to set configuration in the Advanced section of the dialog to add new Kerberos tickets.

histogram.name: Kerberos.ValidateConfigErrorCode
histogram.summary: Error code from an attempt validate Kerberos configuration. Contains more specific information than KerberosErrorType about the result of the validation.

histogram.name: Keyboard.ShortcutViewer.StartupTime
histogram.summary: Time delay between the user gesture that triggered the keyboard shortcut viewer dialog (e.g. pressing Ctrl-Alt-/) and the dialog widget being shown, including layout time for the views::Views.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessoryActionImpression
histogram.summary: Android only. Records whenever users faces an action in the accessory bar or one of its sheets.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessoryActionSelected
histogram.summary: Android only. Records whenever users select an action in the accessory bar or one of its sheets.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessoryBarShown
histogram.summary: Android only. Records how often users encounter the keyboard accessory bar. Its buckets show the contents when it came up. Every bucket may be logged up to one time per impression.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessorySheetSuggestionCount
histogram.summary: Android only. Records how many suggestions a user faced when opening a sheet. The base histogram counts impressions across all sheets.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessorySheetSuggestionsSelected
histogram.summary: Android only. Records which type of suggestion was selected from an open sheet.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessorySheetTriggered
histogram.summary: Android only. Records how often the bottom sheet was opened or closed by a user and the overall count of closures. Closing buckets may be logged up to one time per trigger. There are suffixes for each specific sheet type.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessoryToggleClicked
histogram.summary: Android only. Records how often the user clicks on a certain toggle when opening an accessory sheet together with the state the toggle was in before clicking.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.AccessoryToggleImpression
histogram.summary: Android only. Records how often the user sees a certain toggle when opening an accessory sheet together with the state the toggle was in.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.DisabledSavingAccessoryImpressions
histogram.summary:
Android only. Records the number of times that the keyboard accessory was shown on a form for which saving is disabled (with a crossed-out key icon). Recorded when the user focuses the password field.
Note: Only the "Shown" bucket should contain samples.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.GenerationDialogChoice.{GenerationType}
histogram.summary: Android only. Records the interactions with the password generation dialog for {GenerationType}. Recorded when the user taps a button in the dialog or dismsses it.

histogram.name: Kiosk.Launch.CryptohomeFailure
histogram.summary: Tracks cryptohome failure during kiosk launch.

histogram.name: Kiosk.Launch.Error
histogram.summary: Tracks kiosk launch errors.

histogram.name: Kiosk.LaunchType
histogram.summary: Records kiosk launches, whether it is an enterprise or consumer kiosk and whether it is an auto launch or manual launch.

histogram.name: LanguageDetection.TFLiteModel.LanguageDetectionModelState
histogram.summary: The state of the language detection model used by a TranslateAgent. Recorded once per model load attempt for each renderer process.

histogram.name: LanguageDetection.TFLiteModel.WasModelAvailableForDetection
histogram.summary: Whether the TFLite-based language detection model was available when page content was extracted and a language determination was needed. Recorded once per page load.

histogram.name: LanguageSettings.Actions
histogram.summary: The actions on the languages settings page that result in a preference change. This histogram will record every single event that happens separately. See LanguageSettings.PageImpressions for how often language settings sections are seen.

histogram.name: LanguageSettings.PageImpression
histogram.summary: Impressions of pages, sections, or dialogs viewed from language settings. Page impressions do not result in preferences changes. See LanguageSettings.Actions for preference change counts.

histogram.name: LanguageUsage.AcceptLanguage
histogram.summary: Accept languages with country codes removed. Recorded once per profile intitalization. Incognito profiles are ignored.

histogram.name: LanguageUsage.AcceptLanguage.Count
histogram.summary: The number of accepted languages in the user preferences recored once per profile initialization. Incognito profiles are ignored.

histogram.name: LanguageUsage.ApplicationLanguage
histogram.summary: Application languages used for UI recorded once per profile initialization. Incognito profiles are ignored.

histogram.name: LanguageUsage.MostFrequentPageLanguages
histogram.summary:
Records the source page languages from the UrlLanguageHistogram service.
The UrlLanguageHistogram service saves a dict pref of the page language to frequency for the last 1000 page loads. This histogram is emitted once for all languages that appear in at least 5% of previous page loads. If a profile has 10 or fewer page loads no languages are recorded.
This histogram is recorded once per profile per eligible language during initialization. Incognito profiles are ignored and it is not recorded on ChromeOS.

histogram.name: LanguageUsage.UI.Android.Availability
histogram.summary:
The availability status of Android system languages for use as the Chromium UI language. If the Chromium UI language is overridden, it must be avaliable. The default language is the one used by the JVM for localization. This will be different from the top Android language if the top Android language is not available for localization in Chromium. For more info, see the Android documentation on LocaleList.getDefault().
This histogram is recorded during onForgroundStart() for Android.

histogram.name: LanguageUsage.UI.Android.Correctness
histogram.summary:
The status of the current Chromium UI. It is correct when the UI matches what the JVM default language is set to.
This histogram is recorded during onForgroundStart() for Android.

histogram.name: LanguageUsage.UI.Android.Correctness.NoOverride
histogram.summary:
The status of the current Chromium UI when the UI language is not overridden. The UI language is correct when it matches the default Android system language. If no Android language is available as the Chromium language, then the UI is by definition incorrect.
This histogram is recorded during onForgroundStart() for Android.

histogram.name: LanguageUsage.UI.Android.Correctness.Override
histogram.summary:
The status of the current Chromium UI when the UI language is overridden. The UI language is correct when it matches the override UI value set as the default locale. The Native UI language can be different from the Java UI language if Play Store daily hygiene has not run since an override language was set.
This histogram is recorded during onForgroundStart() for Android.

histogram.name: Launch.FlagsAtStartup
histogram.summary: Logs which Chrome flags from about:flags were active on start up. Android WebView supports flags differently than most platforms, see https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/android_webview/docs/developer-ui.md for details.

histogram.name: Launch.HomeScreen
histogram.summary: Records how Chrome handled a launch from an Android Home screen shortcut.

histogram.name: Launch.HomeScreenSource
histogram.summary:
Records the source of an Android homescreen launch intent used to launch Chrome.
The Menu item bucket is deprecated as of M57, and will only contain records for shortcuts added to the homescreen until M56.
For M57+, the Menu item (standalone) bucket contains all launch intents originating from the add to homescreen menu item that launch to standalone mode and *are not* WebAPKs. These are sites which do not meet the PWA eligibility criteria, but have an app manifest that specifies either standalone or fullscreen display. This bucket also contains PWA *and* non-PWA intents that were added to the homescreen *prior* to M57, as we cannot distinguish between them after they are added.
For M57+, the Menu item (shortcut) bucket contains all launch intents originating from the add to homescreen menu item that launch to a browser tab, regardless of when the intent was added.

histogram.name: Launch.IntentFlags
histogram.summary: Records flags (and combinations of flags) that were attached to the Intent that started ChromeLauncherActivity.

histogram.name: Launch.Modes
histogram.summary: The different ways Chrome is launched.

histogram.name: Launch.WebAppDisplayMode
histogram.summary: Records the display mode (as defined in the Web App Manifest spec) at the launch of the Added to Home screen or installed Web App (including WebAPKs).

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerComplexText
histogram.summary:
For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were complex text fragments, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerFloat
histogram.summary:
For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were floats, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerNode
histogram.summary:
For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerPositioned
histogram.summary:
For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were fixed or absolute positioned, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerSimpleText
histogram.summary:
For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were simple text fragments, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.MicroSecondsPerTD
histogram.summary:
For layouts that considered at least 100 nodes, at least half of which were table cells, the average number of microseconds spent laying out each node.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.AdjustedScrollOffset
histogram.summary: Records the number of times ScrollAnchor adjusts the scroll offset.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.RestorationStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of attempts to restore a serialized scroll anchor.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.SerializedAnchorSelectorLength
histogram.summary: The number of characters in the selector computed for a serialized scroll anchor. Recorded when a scroll anchor is serialized.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.SuppressedBySanaclap
histogram.summary: Records the number of times scroll anchoring is suppressed because of the SANACLAP bit being set on an ancestor (see bit.ly/sanaclap).

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.TimeToComputeAnchorNodeSelector
histogram.summary:
The time it took to compute the selector of a serialized anchor element.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.TimeToFindAnchor
histogram.summary:
The time it took to find a suitable anchor element.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollAnchor.TimeToRestoreAnchor
histogram.summary:
The time it took to restore the scroll anchor using the serialized anchor element.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Lens.ImageClassification.ClassificationTime
histogram.summary: Logged the end to end latency of the Lens image classifcation call when the user completes a long press on an image. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: Lens.ImageClassification.ClassificationTime.EarlyTerminatedMs
histogram.summary: Logged the time between the start of the Lens image classifcation call to the early termination before the call completes. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: Lens.ImageClassification.ClassificationTime.SuccessOnQueryResultMs
histogram.summary: Logged the end to end latency of the Lens image classifcation call when the user completes a long press on an image. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: Lens.ImageClassification.ResultState
histogram.summary: Logged the result state of the Lens image classifcation call when the user completes a long press on an image. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: Lens.ImageClassification.SdkError
histogram.summary: Logged the error code when there is a Lens SDK error occurred within the classification session. The error code is an integer constant defined by the SDK. Only logged on Android. See http://b/170422682 for more details.

histogram.name: Lens.Omnibox.LensSupportStatus
histogram.summary: Whether the user supports the camera assisted search with Google Lens and if not, the reason why. Recorded only if the feature is enabled when the omnibox or the new tab page is loaded.

histogram.name: LevelDB.ApproximateMemTableMemoryUse
histogram.summary: The approximate MemTable memory use of a LevelDB in bytes. Recorded right after initializing an on-disk database.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.DeleteTableBackupFile
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate of deleting an unused leveldb table backup file.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError
histogram.summary: Methods where leveldb's Chromium environment has IO errors.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.MissingFiles
histogram.summary: Number of backup files found without corresponding ldb files. As measured by GetChildren when used in LevelDB clients other than IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBWrapper.CommitDelay
histogram.summary: Delay between the browser process receiving changes and those changes being written to the DB.

histogram.name: LibraryLoader.LoadNativeLibraryWindows
histogram.summary: This metric records the LoadLibraryExW and LoadLibraryW Windows API call results, which are used in native_library_win.cc.

histogram.name: LibraryLoader.PercentageOfResidentCodeBeforePrefetch
histogram.summary: Percentage of the native library code pages resident in memory. Recorded immediately before the library prefetching kicks in, only on Android.

histogram.name: Linux.Distro.Debian
histogram.summary: The Debian version number (eg. 8: Jessie, 9: Stretch). Logged once on startup if Linux.Distro is Debian.

histogram.name: Linux.Distro.Fedora
histogram.summary: The Fedora version number (eg. 27, 28) Logged once on startup if Linux.Distro is Fedora.

histogram.name: Linux.Distro.OpenSuseLeap
histogram.summary: The openSUSE Leap version number, logged as 1000*major + minor (eg. 15001 = 15.1). Logged once on startup if Linux.Distro is openSUSE Leap.

histogram.name: Linux.Distro.Ubuntu
histogram.summary: The Ubuntu version number, logged as 1000*year + month (eg. 16004 = 16.04 Xenial). Logged once on startup if Linux.Distro is Ubuntu.

histogram.name: Linux.Distro2
histogram.summary: The Linux distro used. Logged on each start up.

histogram.name: Linux.GlibcVersion
histogram.summary: The version of glibc used. (Linux only) Logged on each start up.

histogram.name: Linux.SandboxStatus
histogram.summary: The Linux sandbox status. This describes what sandboxing features are enabled (such as the suid/namespace sandboxes, various namespaces, seccomp bpf, ...). Emitted once at startup.

histogram.name: Linux.WindowManager
histogram.summary: The window manager used. (Linux only) Logged on each start up.

histogram.name: Linux.X11.GbmSupportX11CreationTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to construct the GbmSupportX11 singleton.

histogram.name: LiteVideo.CanApplyLiteVideo.HintCache.HasHint
histogram.summary: Whether the LiteVideo hint cache contains hint for the host of the navigation being considered for the LiteVideo optimization. Recorded for every HTTP/HTTPS navigation.

histogram.name: LiteVideo.CanApplyLiteVideo.UserBlocklist
histogram.summary: When determining whether the LiteVideo should be attempted on a navigation, the host could be blocklisted for various reasons. This reports the reason the host of the navigation was blocklisted, or was allowed. Recorded for every HTTP/HTTPS navigation.

histogram.name: LiteVideo.HintAgent.ActiveThrottleSize
histogram.summary: Records the total count of media responses that were currently being throttled. Recorded whenever a new response gets throttled.

histogram.name: LiteVideo.HintAgent.HasHint
histogram.summary: Records whether the LiteVideo hint agent in the renderer process received hints.

histogram.name: LiteVideo.LiteVideoDecider.OptGuideHintCacheSize
histogram.summary: Records the total number of LiteVideoHints, keyed by host, cached locally by the LiteVideoDecider for use when queried by subframes.

histogram.name: LiteVideo.NavigationMetrics.FrameRebufferMapSize
histogram.summary: Records the number of entries in the map that records the number of rebuffer events within each frame. Recorded once per navigation.

histogram.name: LiteVideo.OriginHints.ParseResult
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the hints for configuring LiteVideo throttling provided via Finch were successfully parsed and loaded for use. Android only, recorded once per browser startup.

histogram.name: LiteVideo.URLLoader.ThrottleLatency
histogram.summary: Records how much a media response was throttled by LiteVideo. Recorded once for each throttled response.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.OptimizationHintsReceiveStatus
histogram.summary: The status of when the optimization hints were received by the Loading Predictor. This will be recorded on navigations for which predictions from the Optimization Guide were received.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreconnectCount
histogram.summary: The number of origins that were preconnected for a page load. It includes preconnect attempts that don't result in new opened connection. Logged after the preconnect manager completes all jobs attached to the page load.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreconnectHitsPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of origins that were preconnected and requested by a page load to the total number of origins that were preconnected for a page load. Logged after the preconnect manager completes all jobs attached to the page load.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreconnectLearningCount
histogram.summary: When the loading predictor has origins in the local database for a given navigation to preconnect and preresolve, the count of predicted origins.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreconnectLearningPrecision
histogram.summary: When the loading predictor has origins in the local database for a given navigation to preconnect and preresolve, the precision of the predictions in percentage. This is computed as 100 \times \frac{correct predictions}{predictions}.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreconnectLearningRecall
histogram.summary: When the loading predictor has origins in the local database for a given navigation to preconnect and preresolve, the recall of the predictions, in percentage. This is computed as 100 \times \frac{correct predictions}{all prefetchable subresources}.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreconnectLearningRedirectStatus
histogram.summary: When the prefetch predictor has origins in the local database for a given navigation to preconnect and preresolve, records stats about whether redirect was predicted correctly or incorrectly.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreresolveCount
histogram.summary: The number of hosts that were preresolved for a page load. It includes only successful DNS lookups. Logged after the preconnect manager completes all jobs attached to the page load.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.PreresolveHitsPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of hosts that were preresolved and requested by a page load to the total number of hosts that were preresolved for a page load. Logged after the preconnect manager completes all jobs attached to the page load.

histogram.name: LowPriorityIframes.IframeRequestPriority
histogram.summary: Original Blink priority of the request that belongs to an iframe. Recorded for every request fetched via Blink, but only when the experiment to lower the priority of iframes is enabled.

histogram.name: LowPriorityIframes.MainFrameRequestPriority
histogram.summary: Original Blink priority of the request that belongs to the main frame. Recorded for every request fetched via Blink, but only when the experiment to lower the priority of iframes is enabled.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.CpuTimeMicrosec
histogram.summary: CPU time (for one CPU core) of one Chrome OS ML Service request. Reported for all users; users without high-resolution clocks will report 0 for short requests.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.CpuUsageMilliPercent
histogram.summary: Fraction of total CPU resources used by Chrome OS ML Service, sampled every 5 minutes.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.CreateGraphExecutorResult.Event
histogram.summary: The result of CreateGraphExecutor, which can be OK or some specific error.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.ExecuteResult.Event
histogram.summary: The result of Execute, which can be OK or some specific error.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.GrammarChecker.Check.Event
histogram.summary: The result of grammar check, which can be OK or ERROR.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.GrammarChecker.LoadModelResult.Event
histogram.summary: The result of load grammar model, which can be OK or some specific error. The error code could be logged in machine learning service in chrome or in chromeos when grammar model is not loaded successfully.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.HandwritingModel.LoadModelResult.Event
histogram.summary: The result of load handwriting model, which can be OK or some specific error. The error code could be logged in machine learning service in chrome or in chromeos when handwriting model is not loaded successfully.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.HandwritingModel.Recognize.Event
histogram.summary: The result of handwriting recognition, which can be OK or some specific error.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.LoadModelResult
histogram.summary: The error result of LoadModel in cases when the model name could not be determined. See MachineLearningService.*.LoadModelResult.Event for the result broken down by model name when the name is known.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.LoadModelResult.Event
histogram.summary: The result of LoadModel, which can be OK or some specific error.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.MojoConnectionEvent
histogram.summary: Events related to the connection and disconnection of the Mojo IPC channel between Chrome and the Chrome OS ML Service.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.PeakTotalMemoryKb
histogram.summary: Peak total (shared and non-shared) memory used by Chrome OS ML Service over the last 24 hours. Sampled every 5 minutes, so may miss short-lived spikes.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.TotalMemoryDeltaKb
histogram.summary: Memory usage increase caused by one Chrome OS ML Service request.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.TotalMemoryKb
histogram.summary: Total (shared and non-shared) memory used by Chrome OS ML Service, sampled every 5 minutes.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.BlockedIframeCount
histogram.summary: The number of blocked iframes per unblocked main frame load. The value is recorded when the main frame finishes loading.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.FilteringResult
histogram.summary: The counts of results from supervised user URL filtering. Each entry includes the outcome of the filter (i.e. allowed, blocked, or unknown) and the page transition type (how the user got there, e.g. typed URL, clicked link).

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.KidsManagementClassifyUrlFailureDelay
histogram.summary: The extra page load delays introduced by network requests due to the supervised user url filtering feature, measured once per page load, for failed requests. This is the delay to fetch the token and call the ClassifyUrl rpc, when there is a cache miss.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.KidsManagementClassifyUrlSuccessDelay
histogram.summary: The extra page load delays introduced by network requests due to the supervised user url filtering feature, measured once per page load. This is the delay to fetch the token and call the ClassifyUrl rpc, when there is a cache miss. Only recorded for successful requests.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.KidsManagementUrlCheckerResponseStatus
histogram.summary: The counts of response status from supervised user KidsManagementURLCheckerCLient. Each entry includes the outcome of a request (i.e. success, net error, parsing error).

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.RequestPermissionSource
histogram.summary: The counts of request for permission sent from main frame or sub-frame.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.SafeSitesDelay
histogram.summary: The extra page load delays introduced by network requests due to the supervised user SafeSites feature, measured once per page load.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.SafetyFilter
histogram.summary: The counts of results from the supervised user safety filter. Each entry includes the outcome of the filter (i.e. allowed, blocked, or unknown) and the page transition type (how the user got there, e.g. typed URL, clicked link). This only includes URL requests that were handled by the SafeSites filter (both online and the static blacklist).

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.Whitelist.Count
histogram.summary: The number of allowlists installed for a supervised user. Recorded at every profile startup.

histogram.name: Manifest.FetchResult
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the Manifest fetch succeed and why it failed if it failed.

histogram.name: Manifest.HasProperty
histogram.summary: Tracks which properties of a Manifest were present when it was parsed. If a property can't be parsed, it will be recorded as not present. These histograms will only be used if the Manifest was correctly fetched and parsed and the parsed manifest is not empty.

histogram.name: Manifest.ParseSuccess
histogram.summary: Tracks the Manifest parsing result. A failure will be recorded if the Manifest was incorrectly structured. This doesn't take into account parse failures for each individual properties.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.BottomSheet.CloseReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason that the merchant trust bottom sheet is closed. Recorded when the bottom sheet is closed. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.BottomSheet.DurationFullyOpened
histogram.summary: Records the duration in milliseconds that the merchant trust bottom sheet is left fully expanded. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.BottomSheet.DurationHalfOpened
histogram.summary: Records the duration in milliseconds that the merchant trust bottom sheet is left half expanded. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.BottomSheet.DurationPeeked
histogram.summary: Records the duration in milliseconds that the merchant trust bottom sheet is peeking. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.BottomSheet.IsFullyViewed
histogram.summary: Records whether the merchant trust bottom sheet is fully expanded. Recorded when the bottom sheet is closed. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.BottomSheet.IsHalfViewed
histogram.summary: Records whether the merchant trust bottom sheet is half expanded. Recorded when the bottom sheet is closed. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.Message.ClearReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason that the merchant trust message is cleared in the MessageDispatcher queue. Right now we only record message being cleared when user navigates away from current page. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.Message.DismissReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason that the merchant trust message is dismissed. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.Message.DurationPrepared
histogram.summary: Records the duration in milliseconds that the merchant trust message is in the MessageDispatcher queue. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.Message.DurationShown
histogram.summary: Records the duration in milliseconds that the merchant trust message is shown. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Mist.SwitchResult
histogram.summary: The result (e.g. success or the type of failure) of a modem interface switch operation performed by mist on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: MixedAutoupgrade.ResourceRequest.ErrorOrResponseCode
histogram.summary: The net error or HTTP response code of a mixed content resource request that was autoupgraded to HTTPS

histogram.name: MixedAutoupgrade.ResourceRequest.Failure.IsAd
histogram.summary: Whether or not an autoupgrade mixed content request was for a resource we know to be an ad

histogram.name: MixedAutoupgrade.ResourceRequest.Failure.Type
histogram.summary: Logs the type of each resource request that is autoupgraded to HTTPS and fails to load.

histogram.name: MixedAutoupgrade.ResourceRequest.Response.Type
histogram.summary: Logs the type of each resource request that was autoupgraded to HTTPS and resulted in a response.

histogram.name: MixedAutoupgrade.ResourceRequest.Start.Type
histogram.summary: Logs the type of each resource request that is autoupgraded to HTTPS. This is logged when the request is started.

histogram.name: MixedAutoupgrade.ResourceRequest.Status
histogram.summary: The status of a mixed content resource request that was autoupgraded to HTTPS

histogram.name: ModuleBlacklistCache.BlacklistPathUpdated
histogram.summary: Records the result of writing the path of the module blocklist cache to the registry so that chrome_elf.dll can use it. A value is emitted every time the cache is updated because another instance of Chrome with a different User Data directory could have overwritten the path to point to their own version of the cache.

histogram.name: ModuleBlacklistCache.BlacklistStatus
histogram.summary: The status of a blocklisted module in the process. Recorded when the cache is updated.

histogram.name: ModuleBlacklistCache.DeleteResult
histogram.summary: The result of deleting the module blocklist cache when third-party module blocking is disabled. Attempting to delete an empty file is considered a success.

histogram.name: ModuleBlacklistCache.ExpectedMD5Digest
histogram.summary: Records whether the MD5 digest of the module blocklist cache matched the one recorded in the Local State file.

histogram.name: ModuleBlacklistCache.ModuleCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of modules in the module blocklist cache at the time it was written to disk.

histogram.name: ModuleBlacklistCache.ReadResult
histogram.summary: The result of reading the current module blocklist cache while updating it.

histogram.name: ModuleBlacklistCache.WriteResult
histogram.summary: The result of writing the updated module blocklist cache.

histogram.name: ModuleBlocklistCache.BlocklistPathUpdated
histogram.summary: Records the result of writing the path of the module blocklist cache to the registry so that chrome_elf.dll can use it. A value is emitted every time the cache is updated because another instance of Chrome with a different User Data directory could have overwritten the path to point to their own version of the cache.

histogram.name: ModuleBlocklistCache.BlocklistStatus
histogram.summary: The status of a blocklisted module in the process. Recorded when the cache is updated.

histogram.name: ModuleBlocklistCache.DeleteResult
histogram.summary: The result of deleting the module blocklist cache when third-party module blocking is disabled. Attempting to delete an empty file is considered a success.

histogram.name: ModuleBlocklistCache.ExpectedMD5Digest
histogram.summary: Records whether the MD5 digest of the module blocklist cache matched the one recorded in the Local State file.

histogram.name: ModuleBlocklistCache.ModuleCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of modules in the module blocklist cache at the time it was written to disk.

histogram.name: ModuleBlocklistCache.ReadResult
histogram.summary: The result of reading the current module blocklist cache while updating it.

histogram.name: ModuleBlocklistCache.WriteResult
histogram.summary: The result of writing the updated module blocklist cache.

histogram.name: ModuleIntegrityVerification.BytesModified
histogram.summary: Represents the amount of bytes in a module that are different on disk and in memory. Logged when the ModuleIntegrityVerifier determines that a module is different on disk and in memory after being triggered by an incident.

histogram.name: ModuleIntegrityVerification.RelocationsUnordered
histogram.summary: Logged when the relocations in a module are not ordered causing the module verification to abort.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.Linux.SharedMemWriteBytes
histogram.summary: The size in bytes of individual messages written into shared memory.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.Linux.SharedMemWriteBytes_Fail_NoLock
histogram.summary: The size in bytes of individual messages that could not be written due to lock contention.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.Linux.SharedMemWriteBytes_Fail_NoSpace
histogram.summary: The size in bytes of individual messages that could not be written due to shared memory buffer exhaustion.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.Linux.SharedMemWriteBytes_Fail_TooLarge
histogram.summary: The size in bytes of individual messages that could not be written due to message being larger than the shared buffer size.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.WriteMessageHandles
histogram.summary: The number of handles sent with a channel message.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.WriteMessageLatency
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken to fully write a channel message to the underlying channel.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.WriteMessageSize
histogram.summary: The size of a message written to a channel.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.WriteQueued
histogram.summary: Tracks whether or not a message is written directly to a channel or queued.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.WriteQueuePendingMessages
histogram.summary: The number queued messages waiting to be written, measured when a channel flush is attempted.

histogram.name: Mojo.Channel.WritevBatchedMessages
histogram.summary: The number of messages batched into a single writev call.

histogram.name: Mojo.Connector.MaxUnreadMessageQuotaUsed
histogram.summary: The maximal unread message quota used for the lifetime of a Connector. This is sampled for a configurable percentage of Connectors only when the feature MojoRecordUnreadMessageCount is enabled. By default 1% of Connectors are sampled, as there's some overhead involved in enabling the unread message quota on a MessagePipe. See //mojo/public/cpp/bindings/lib/connector.cc.

histogram.name: Mojo.InvalidUTF8String
histogram.summary: Emitted any time a Mojo string is deserialized and is not valid UTF-8.

histogram.name: MojoLevelDBEnv.IOError
histogram.summary: Methods where leveldb's Mojo environment has IO errors.

histogram.name: Mouse.Acceleration.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks mouse acceleration setting changes by the user. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Mouse.Acceleration.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks mouse acceleration setting on startup. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Mouse.PointerSensitivity.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks mouse sensitivity setting changes by the user. This replaces the old Mouse.Sensitivity.Changed metric. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Mouse.PointerSensitivity.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks mouse sensitivity setting on startup. This replaces the old Mouse.Sensitivity.Started metric. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Mouse.ReverseScroll.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks mouse reverse scroll setting changes by the user. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Mouse.ReverseScroll.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks mouse reverse scroll setting on startup. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Mouse.ScrollAcceleration
histogram.summary: Whether mouse scroll acceleration is enabled. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Mouse.ScrollSensitivity
histogram.summary: Mouse scroll sensitivity value. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: MPArch.ChildProcessLaunchFirst
histogram.summary: The time it takes to spawn the first child subprocess (including sandbox init).

histogram.name: MPArch.ChildProcessLaunchSubsequent
histogram.summary: The time it takes to spawn child sub processes not counting the first one.

histogram.name: MPArch.ForkTime
histogram.summary: Time to call fork() or clone(), in ms. Recorded at each fork excluding from the zygote, only on posix platforms.

histogram.name: MPArch.RPHCountPerLoad
histogram.summary: The number of RenderProcessHosts (i.e. renderer processes) present when each load completes. This is basically the average number of sub-processes over time. See also Tabs.TabCountPerLoad.

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_RepaintDelta
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_TabSwitchPaintDuration
histogram.summary: Time from tab switch requested to tab appearing on screen (Aura and Mac only). Replaced by Browser.Tabs.TotalSwitchDuration.*

histogram.name: MultiDeviceSetup.OOBE.UserChoice
histogram.summary: Breaks down the percentage of users who either accepted or declined MultiDevice OOBE setup.

histogram.name: MultiDeviceSetup_NotificationClicked
histogram.summary: Counts the number of each MultiDevice setup notification clicked by a user. This metric should be compared with MultiDeviceSetup_NotificationShown.

histogram.name: MultiDeviceSetup_NotificationDismissed
histogram.summary: Counts the number of each MultiDevice setup notification dismissed by a user. This metric should be compared with MultiDeviceSetup_NotificationShown.

histogram.name: MultiDeviceSetup_NotificationShown
histogram.summary: Counts the number of each MultiDevice setup notification shown to a user.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.SwitchActiveUserUIPath
histogram.summary: Count the number of times each UI path is taken for switching the active account in a Chrome OS multiprofile session. UI paths include the system tray and the keyboard shortcut.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.TeleportWindowType
histogram.summary: Counts the number of teleported windows by types in separated desktop mode.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.UsersPerSessionIncremental
histogram.summary: The number of users simultaneously signed into a multiprofile session on Chrome OS. This is recorded whenever a user gets added to the session. To get the correct count, all following counts must be subtracted. Example: If 100 single user, 20 two user and 5 three user sessions, there were 100-20-5=75 single user sessions, 100-80=20 dual user sessions and so on.

histogram.name: NativeFileSystemAPI.ConfirmReadDirectoryResult
histogram.summary: Did the user confirm read access to a directory via the Native File System API.

histogram.name: NativeFileSystemAPI.FileChooserResult
histogram.summary: The number of files a user picked using the file picker in the Native File System API. Recorded as 0 if the user cancelled the picker.

histogram.name: NativeFileSystemAPI.ReadPermissionRequestOutcome
histogram.summary: The result of an attempt to request write permission to a file or directory via the Native File System API.

histogram.name: NativeFileSystemAPI.SensitiveDirectoryAccessResult
histogram.summary: Records if the file or directory selected by the user through the Native File System API is considered a sensitive directory, and thus was blocked.

histogram.name: NativeFileSystemAPI.WritePermissionRequestOutcome
histogram.summary: The result of an attempt to request write permission to a file or directory via the Native File System API.

histogram.name: NativeSmbFileShare.AuthenticationMethod
histogram.summary: The method used to authenticate to a share. This is called on each attempted mount.

histogram.name: NativeSmbFileShare.GetSharesResult
histogram.summary: The result of the GetShares operation for Native SMB File Share. This is recorded after the D-Bus call to GetShares returns.

histogram.name: NativeSmbFileShare.MountCount
histogram.summary: The number of active mounts that a user has. This is recorded after a share has been successfully mounted.

histogram.name: NativeSmbFileShare.MountResult
histogram.summary: The result of the mount operation for Native SMB File Share. This is recorded after the D-Bus call to Mount returns.

histogram.name: NativeSmbFileShare.ReadDirectoryCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M87. No longer used with smbfs.
histogram.summary: The number of entries read when calling ReadDirectory. This is recorded after the D-Bus call to ReadDirectory returns.

histogram.name: NativeSmbFileShare.ReadDirectoryDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M87. No longer used with smbfs.
histogram.summary: The duration of ReadDirectory call to SmbProvider in milliseconds. This is recorded after the D-Bus call returns.

histogram.name: NativeSmbFileShare.RemountResult
histogram.summary: The result of the Remount operation during startup. This is recorded after the D-Bus call to Remount returns.

histogram.name: NativeTheme.GetSystemColor
histogram.summary: Time required to run ui::NativeTheme::GetSystemColor().

histogram.name: NativeTheme.GetSystemColor.UsesColorProvider
histogram.summary: Records if the color provider computed the color.

histogram.name: NCN.CellularConnectionSubtype
histogram.summary: The connection subtype of the network the client is connected to, when the client is on a cellular connection. This histogram is logged once per UMA record, if the user is on a cellular connection, at the time the record is finalized.

histogram.name: NCN.NetworkOperatorMCCMNC
histogram.summary: The MCC (mobile country code) and MNC (mobile network code) of the network operator when a new metrics log is created or when the network connection is changed. A value of zero means a non-mobile network or the operator code is unknown.

histogram.name: net.HttpIdentSrcURL
histogram.summary: Count of requests which contained a basic auth username and password embedded in the URL itself.

histogram.name: Networks.RememberedShared
histogram.summary: Number of shared remembered (preferred) networks on Chrome OS. Updated any time the network list changes.

histogram.name: Networks.RememberedUnshared
histogram.summary: Number of private remembered (preferred) networks on Chrome OS. Updated any time the network list changes.

histogram.name: Networks.Visible
histogram.summary: Number of visible (in-range) networks on Chrome OS. Updated any time the network list changes.

histogram.name: NQE.CachedNetworkQualityAvailable
histogram.summary: Records if the cached network quality (from memory or from a persistent source) was available. Recorded right after connection change event.

histogram.name: NQE.CellularSignalStrength.ECTReduction
histogram.summary: Number of buckets by which effective connection type was reduced or capped due to low cellular signal strength. Recorded only on cellular networks, and only when the value of the effective connection typed is capped.

histogram.name: NQE.CellularSignalStrength.LevelAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the signal strength for the cellular network was available or not. Recorded right before a connection change event. Recorded only on cellular connections on Android platform.

histogram.name: NQE.ConnectivityMonitor.NetworkChangeEvent
histogram.summary: When ConnectivityMonitor establishes that the current default network may be failing and is Wi-Fi, it asks the operating system to activate a mobile network for subsequent use. Whenever the system's default network changes, this logs the relationship between the new default network and the network preemptively activated by ConnectivityMonitor, if any.

histogram.name: NQE.ConnectivityMonitor.TimeToSwitchNetworks
histogram.summary: The Network Quality Estimator (NQE) observes network activity to look for connectivity issues. If it begins to observe failures on a previously functioning network, it tracks the time at which the failures were first observed. If the device subsequently switches its default network to different network (or offline), this histogram logs the number of milliseconds elapsed since the original failures were observed.

histogram.name: NQE.EffectiveConnectionType.OnECTComputation
histogram.summary: Effective connection type estimated by the network quality estimator. Recorded every time the effective connection type is computed.

histogram.name: NQE.EndToEndRTT.OnECTComputation
histogram.summary: Rough estimate of the computed end-to-end round trip time. Recorded by the network quality estimator every time the effective connection type is computed.

histogram.name: NQE.HttpRttReduction.BasedOnRTTCounts
histogram.summary: Duration by which HTTP RTT was reduced because of low confidence.

histogram.name: NQE.Kbps.OnECTComputation
histogram.summary: Rough estimate of the downstream peak throughput (in kilobits per second). Recorded by the network quality estimator every time the effective connection type is computed.

histogram.name: NQE.NetworkIdAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the NetworkID (SSID of the Wi-Fi network, or the MCC/MNC operator of the cellular network) was available or not. Recorded only on Wi-Fi and cellular networks. Recorded right after the connection type changes.

histogram.name: NQE.Prefs.ReadCount
histogram.summary: Number of times the network quality prefs were read by the network quality estimator.

histogram.name: NQE.Prefs.ReadSize
histogram.summary: Count of the number of network IDs in the prefs read by the network quality estimator.

histogram.name: NQE.Prefs.WriteCount
histogram.summary: Number of times the network quality prefs were written by the network quality estimator.

histogram.name: NQE.RTT.ObservationSource
histogram.summary: Number of RTT observations indexed by the source of the observation. Recorded by the network quality estimator every time a new observation is made or synthesized.

histogram.name: NQE.RTT.OnECTComputation
histogram.summary: Rough estimate of the round trip time at the URLRequest layer. Recorded by the network quality estimator every time the effective connection type is computed.

histogram.name: NQE.SignalStrengthQueried
histogram.summary: Recorded as true when the signal strength of the current network is queried.

histogram.name: NQE.TransportRTT.OnECTComputation
histogram.summary: Rough estimate of the computed round trip time at the transport layer. Recorded by the network quality estimator every time the effective connection type is computed.

histogram.name: NQE.WifiSignalStrength.LevelAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the signal strength for the Wifi network was available or not. Recorded right before a connection change event. Recorded only on Wifi connections on Android platform.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.MergeSessionFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of MergeSession call during Chrome OS login, Chrome Signin or account addition. On all OSes as of M44 (previously CrOS only).

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.MergeSessionRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed MergeSession call during Chrome OS login, Chrome Signin or account addition. On all OSes as of M44 (previously CrOS only).

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.PostMergeVerification
histogram.summary: Outcome of Chrome OS GAIA cookie post-merge session verification process. It measures how often /MergeSession request collided with browser session restore process resulting in partially authenticated primary GAIA session.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.PreMergeVerification
histogram.summary: Outcome of Chrome OS GAIA cookie pre-merge session verification process. It measures how often we need to perform /MergeSession request to re-authenticated exisitng user with GAIA.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.SessionRestore
histogram.summary: Outcome of Chrome OS GAIA cookie session restore process.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.SessionRestoreTimeToFailure
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the session restore to fail.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.SessionRestoreTimeToSuccess
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the session restore to finish succeessfully.

histogram.name: OccludedWindowMouseEvents
histogram.summary: Incremented each time a mouse event is handled by a window that is marked as occluded. This number should be 0 or very close to 0. It should be much less than the number of times a window is mark occluded - WindowOcclusionChanged.Occluded.

histogram.name: OffscreenCanvas.TextMetrics.SetFont
histogram.summary:
Time spent in microseconds to perform call SetFont in canvas for OffscreenCanvas. It's measured each time SetFont is called.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: OriginTrials.ValidationResult
histogram.summary: Counts the results of token validation checks to enable experimental features. The result for each token validation check is counted once per token per execution context (e.g. page, worker).

histogram.name: OSCrypt.BackendUsage
histogram.summary: The backend selected for this user and whether it was initialised successfully.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.Win.KeyDecryptionError
histogram.summary: The Windows GetLastError after a failure from calling into DPAPI to decrypt the master key for the os_crypt library on Windows. This is recorded during the OSCrypt::Init each time the decryption fails.

histogram.name: OSX.ExceptionHandlerEvents
histogram.summary: Events seen by the OSX NSException swizzle.

histogram.name: OSX.Fullscreen.Enter.Source
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a user triggers fullscreen for a browser window. It indicates if the fullscreen is triggered for the browser or the tab content.

histogram.name: OSX.Fullscreen.Enter.Style
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a user triggers fullscreen for a browser window. It indicates the mechanism (immersive vs. AppKit) and the type of AppKit Fullscreen (Presentation Mode vs. Canonical Fullscreen).

histogram.name: OSX.Fullscreen.Enter.WindowLocation
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a user triggers fullscreen for a browser window. It indicates the screen in which the window was fullscreened, and the number of screens available.

histogram.name: OSX.Handoff.Origin
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a Handoff is received by Chrome on OSX. The enumeration indicates the source of the Handoff.

histogram.name: OSX.Installation.OtherChromeInstances
histogram.summary: The instances of other copies of Google Chrome on the user's Mac. Logged once on startup, and only for Chrome Beta and Chrome Dev. Will be used to determine if/how home directory migration will be done for side-by-side.

histogram.name: OSX.NativeShare
histogram.summary: Whether the user successfully shared via a native sharing extensions after selecting it from the share menu. False can indicate failure or user-initiated cancellation.

histogram.name: OSX.Settings.ScreensHaveSeparateSpaces
histogram.summary: The configuration of the setting "Screens Have Separate Spaces" available in OSX 10.9+.

histogram.name: OSX.SystemHotkeyMap.LoadSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to load the system hotkeys on a Mac was successful.

histogram.name: OutdatedUpgradeBubble.NumLaterPerEnableAU
