histogram.name: SignedExchange.SignatureVerificationError.NotYetValid
histogram.summary: Recorded when Signed Exchange signature was not yet valid. Records the time delta between current time and signature's "date" value.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.SignatureVerificationResult
histogram.summary: Reports the result of Signed Exchange signature verification, including success.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.Time.CertificateFetch.Failure
histogram.summary: The amount of time elapsed to fetch certificate chain from certUrl, for which the fetch has failed.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.Time.CertificateFetch.Success
histogram.summary: The amount of time elapsed to fetch certificate chain from certUrl, for which the fetch has succeeded.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.Time.SignatureVerify
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during SignedExchangeSignatureVerifier::Verify.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.TimeUntilExpiration
histogram.summary: Number of seconds until the Signed Exchange's expiration time. Recorded when Signed Exchange signature verification is performed, and emitted only for Signed Exchanges within the validity period.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.ValidityPingDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time elapsed to ping the original publisher of the Signed Exchanges.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.ValidityPingResult
histogram.summary: Reports the result of the Signed Exchange validity ping.

histogram.name: SingleWebsitePreferences.NavigatedFromToReset
histogram.summary: Logs which way had the user navigated into settings screens when they press "Clear and Reset" button in settings of a single website.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.DaysSinceLastShortcutLaunch
histogram.summary: The number of days between launches of an origin saved to homescreen or as a bookmark app shortcut. Recorded at the second and each following launch of a specific origin from a shortcut, independently per origin.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementScore
histogram.summary: Distribution of the engagement scores accumulated by a user, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementScoreBucket
histogram.summary: The percentage of sites on a user's profile that have engagement scores that fall in these buckets, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementType
histogram.summary: The type of engagement (navigation, user input, etc.) which led to an accumulation in site engagement.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.MeanEngagement
histogram.summary: The mean site engagement per origin accumulated by this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.MedianEngagement
histogram.summary: The median site engagement per origin accumulated by this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.OriginsEngaged
histogram.summary: The total number of origins with a non-zero site engagement score for this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.OriginsWithMaxDailyEngagement
histogram.summary: The number of origins which have reached the daily site engagement point cap, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter. Thus, each bin N contains the number of clients where at least N origins have reached the maximum daily site engagement point cap.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.OriginsWithMaxEngagement
histogram.summary: The number of origins which have reached the absolute site engagement point cap, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter. Thus, each bin N contains the number of clients where at least N origins have reached the maximum absolute site engagement point cap.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.TotalEngagement
histogram.summary: The total site engagement accumulated by this profile, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteIsolatedCodeCache.JS.Behaviour
histogram.summary: The behaviour of site isolated javascript code cache recorded for each cache transaction. It records if the request was serviced and if serviced how it was serviced for ex: hit, miss, update.

histogram.name: SiteIsolatedCodeCache.WASM.Behaviour
histogram.summary: The behaviour of site isolated web assembly code cache recorded for each cache transaction during WASM compilation. It records if the request was serviced and if serviced how it was serviced for ex: hit, miss, update.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.BrowsingInstance.MaxCountPerProcess
histogram.summary: The maximum number of BrowsingInstances seen in a RenderProcessHost over its lifetime. Recorded once when ChildProcessImpl::SecurityState::~SecurityState() is invoked.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.BrowsingInstanceCount
histogram.summary: The count of all current BrowsingInstances. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CORBProtection.CacheHeuristic
histogram.summary: The blocking decision CORB would have made on the response, if the request was cross-origin. Reported if the response looked sensitive under the cache heuristic (i.e. had Cache-Control: Private and Vary: Origin response headers).

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CORBProtection.CacheHeuristic.ProtectedMimeType
histogram.summary: True if the response has an Accept-Ranges header, which indicates the server supports range requests on the resource and could be used to bypass CORB. Only reported if the resource looked sensitive under the Cache heuristic and was a protected MIME type.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CORBProtection.CORSHeuristic
histogram.summary: The blocking decision CORB would have made on the response, if the request was cross-origin. Reported if the response looked sensitive under the CORS heuristic (i.e. had the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header with a value other than * or null).

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CORBProtection.CORSHeuristic.ProtectedMimeType
histogram.summary: True if the response has an Accept-Ranges header, which indicates the server supports range requests on the resource and could be used to bypass CORB. Only reported if the resource looked sensitive under the CORS heuristic and was a protected MIME type.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CORBProtection.ProtectedMimeType.BlockedWithoutSniffing.HasNoSniff
histogram.summary: True if the response has a nosniff header. If the nosniff header is not present, then CORB must have decided to block without sniffing due to a partial response, or because the MIME type was a never sniff type. Only reported on resources CORB would have blocked/protected without sniffing that have a protected MIME type.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CORBProtection.SensitiveResource
histogram.summary: True if the resource was found to be sensitive by either the CORS or Cache heuristics. Recorded for every resource CORB sees.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CORBProtection.SensitiveWithRangeSupport
histogram.summary: True if the response has an Accept-Ranges header, which indicates the server supports range requests on the resource. Only reported if the response looked sensitive under the cache or CORS heuristics.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.FileSystemApi.CanAccessDataForOriginFailure.IsHttpBasedScheme
histogram.summary: Logged when FileSystemManagerImpl::Open fails CanAccessDataForOrigin check. The value indicates whether the requested origin came from a http/https origin VS from another origin (possibly from a Chrome App).

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsPasswordFormSubmittedInDedicatedProcess
histogram.summary: Logs whether or not a password form was submitted from a site-isolated process that's dedicated to a single site. Recorded when a password form is submitted.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ORB.ResponseHeadersHeuristic.Decision
histogram.summary:
The approximation of a route that Opaque Response Blocking (ORB) algorithm would have taken to decide whether to block the response or not. The logged value is based on heuristics that only look at the HTTP response headers, and attempt to approximate if the full ORB algorithm would need to parse the response body as Javascript (vs also reaching a decision purely based on the HTTP response headers).
Note that only partial ORB algorithm is used for logging the UMA (e.g. no multimedia sniffing and/or 206-response processing is done). This means that the results overestimate how many responses need Javascript parsing.
Logged for each final HTTP/HTTPS response processed by the NetworkService.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ORB.ResponseHeadersHeuristic.{OrbDecision}
histogram.summary:
The request destination (e.g. script vs image) of a response that Opaque Response Blocking (ORB) algorithm processed {OrbDecision}.
Note that only partial ORB algorithm is used for logging the UMA (e.g. no multimedia sniffing and/or 206-response processing is done). This means that the results overestimate how many responses need Javascript parsing.
Logged for each final HTTP/HTTPS response processed by the NetworkService.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.OutOfProcessIframes
histogram.summary: The count of all out-of-process iframes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ProxyCount
histogram.summary: The count of all RenderFrameProxyHosts. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ProxyCountPerBrowsingInstance
histogram.summary: The count of RenderFrameProxyHosts in each BrowsingInstance. Recorded each UMA ping, once per BrowsingInstance.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ReusePendingOrCommittedSite.CouldReuse
histogram.summary: Whether SiteInstances with a ProcessReusePolicy of REUSE_PENDING_OR_COMMITTED_SITE could reuse an existing RenderProcessHost or they had to create a new one. True when they reused an existing process, false when they created a new one.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ReusePendingOrCommittedSite.TimeSinceReusableProcessDestroyed
histogram.summary: Recorded on navigations with a ProcessReusePolicy of REUSE_PENDING_OR_COMMITTED_SITE (mostly subframe navigations). Measures the time since a RenderProcessHost hosting the destination URL was last destroyed, up to 10 seconds. If no host matching the destination was recently destroyed, a sentinel value of 20 seconds is used.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.SavedUserTriggeredIsolatedOrigins.Size
histogram.summary: The number of currently saved user-triggered isolated sites. This includes sites where the user has entered a password while using Site Isolation for password sites (which is the target Site Isolation mode for Android). Recorded once on browser startup.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.SiteInstancesPerBrowsingInstance
histogram.summary: The count of SiteInstances in a single BrowsingInstance. Recorded each UMA ping, once per BrowsingInstance.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Browser.Action
histogram.summary: Various actions related to cross-site document blocking in the browser process, indicating whether the response was blocked from the renderer. Recorded as the response is processed in the network stack.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Browser.Blocked.CanonicalMimeType
histogram.summary: The total count of responses that were blocked by the cross-site document blocking logic in the browser process. Recorded with a canonical MIME type when the response is blocked.

histogram.name: Skia.DrawScaleFactor
histogram.summary: The scale factor of any images drawn by Skia.

histogram.name: Skia.DrawTiled
histogram.summary: Whether a call to drawBitmap(Rect) or drawImage(Rect) used the tiled or non-tiled rasterization path.

histogram.name: Skia.FilterQuality
histogram.summary: The count of images drawn by Skia with a given filter quality.

histogram.name: Skia.LockTexturePath
histogram.summary: The path taken by Skia when it attempts to lock a texture for use.

histogram.name: Skia.SubmitRenderPasses
histogram.summary: The number of Skia render passes sent to the GPU during a GrContext::submit call. The max value that is sent here is 100 so anything in the 100 bucket actually includes render pass counts of 100+. Though we don't expect to be reaching 100 render passes often. This is collected each time we submit to the GPU in Skia.

histogram.name: Skia.VulkanMemoryAllocator.AmountAllocated
histogram.summary: The total amount of memory that the GrVkMemoryAllocator used by Skia's Vulkan backend has allocated. This is GPU memory for VkImages and VkBuffers. Note that the allocator may be shared with other users outside of Skia and this amount includes their uses as well. This is collected each time we request an allocation from Skia.

histogram.name: Skia.VulkanMemoryAllocator.PercentUsed
histogram.summary: The percent of allocated memory that is in use by the GrVkMemoryAllocator used by Skia's Vulkan backend. This is GPU memory for VkImages and VkBuffers. Note that the allocator may be shared with other users outside of Skia and this includes their allocations as well. This is collected each time we request an allocation from Skia.

histogram.name: Snackbar.Shown
histogram.summary: Records the identifier of a snackbar every time one is shown.

histogram.name: SpecialLocale.PromotionDialog
histogram.summary: Records how users interact with the special locale promotion dialog.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Android.Available
histogram.summary:
Whether the Android spellchecking service was available at the start of a new spellchecking session. Note that the user can disable the Android spellchecking service in settings, in which case it will show up as not available in the histogram.
Warning: for chrome versions 78-88 this histogram was listed as expired, so for that period the data might be missing or incomplete.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.Android.Latency
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it takes to receive results from the spellchecking service on Android. More precisely this is the SystemClock.elapsedRealtime() between the SpellCheckerSession.getSentenceSuggestions() and the invocation of the onGetSentenceSuggestions() callback.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.MisspellRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2021/01: the relevant code path isn't used anymore.
histogram.summary: The percentage of misspelled words within checked words.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.ReplaceRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2021/01: the relevant code path isn't used anymore.
histogram.summary: The percentage of replaced words within misspelled words.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.SpellingService.Enabled
histogram.summary: Whether the user has opted in to asking Google for spelling suggestions. Recorded both when spelling is initialized and when the preference is changed.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.SpellingService.RequestDuration
histogram.summary: The elapsed time, in ms, between the moment the SimpleURLLoader starts downloading the request and the moment the SimpleURLLoader callback is invoked after the request finishes, whether an error or a success.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.SpellingService.RequestHttpResponseCode
histogram.summary: The HTTP code of Spelling service responses.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.SpellingService.RequestResultType
histogram.summary: Describes the results returned by the Spelling service by assigning them to one of three high-level buckets: request/service error, success with no suggestions, and success with spelling suggestions.

histogram.name: SpellCheck.SuggestionHitRatio
histogram.summary: The percentage of replacement executions within suggestion occurrences.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Windows.ChromeLocalesSupport
histogram.summary:
Counts how many languages are added to Chrome by the user but are not supported for spell check (today Chrome only supports a hard-coded list of locales for spell check).
This is a measure of the potential impact of adding support for non-Hunspell locales in the spell check settings. This also helps answer the following question: should the Chrome spell check settings raise awareness of Windows language packs and / or link to documentation describing how to install a Windows language pack?
This is recorded once during spell check initialization, and then once each time the user changes their Chrome languages.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Windows.SpellcheckLocalesSupport
histogram.summary:
Of all the currently enabled spell check languages, counts how many are supported by the different spell checkers (Hunspell and the Windows OS).
This helps measure the impact and reach of the native spell checker integration.
This is recorded once during spell check initialization, and then once each time the user changes their enabled spell check languages.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Windows.SpellcheckRequestDuration
histogram.summary:
Measures the time it takes to perform one spell check end to end. The start time is taken just before invoking Hunspell or the native spell checker (via Mojo), and the end time is taken just before invoking the Blink spell check callback.
This is recorded every time a spell check is performed.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Windows.SuggestionGatheringDuration
histogram.summary:
Measures the time it takes to generate spelling suggestions when a user right clicks a misspelled word. The start time is taken just before invoking Hunspell for the suggestions, and the end time is taken just after the final suggestion list is constructed.
This is recorded every time the user opens the context menu on a misspelled word, but only if the suggestions hadn't been pre-generated (which happens when all spell check locales are supported by the OS spell checker).

histogram.name: Sqlite.CloseFailure
histogram.summary: Error which prevented database close.

histogram.name: Sqlite.DeprecationVersionResult
histogram.summary: Annotations for which bits of sql::MetaTable::CheckDeprecated() fire.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Error
histogram.summary: SQLite extended error codes.

histogram.name: Sqlite.MemoryKB.OneDay
histogram.summary: SQLite memory footprint from sqlite3_memory_used() recorded 1 day after first database is opened by sql::Database.

histogram.name: Sqlite.MemoryKB.OneHour
histogram.summary: SQLite memory footprint from sqlite3_memory_used() recorded 1 hour after first database is opened by sql::Database.

histogram.name: Sqlite.MemoryKB.OneWeek
histogram.summary: SQLite memory footprint from sqlite3_memory_used() recorded 1 week after first database is opened by sql::Database.

histogram.name: Sqlite.MemoryKB.TenMinutes
histogram.summary: SQLite memory footprint from sqlite3_memory_used() recorded 10 minutes after first database is opened by sql::Database.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Migration.History
histogram.summary: Time used to migrate History database schema to a new version.

histogram.name: Sqlite.OpenFailure
histogram.summary: Error which prevented database open.

histogram.name: Sqlite.OpenProbeFailure
histogram.summary: Error from first read of the database.

histogram.name: Sqlite.RazeDatabase
histogram.summary: Errors attempting to Raze() database.

histogram.name: Sqlite.RazeDatabase2
histogram.summary: Errors on second attempt to Raze() database.

histogram.name: Sqlite.RazeDatabaseTruncate
histogram.summary: Errors truncating database for Raze().

histogram.name: Sqlite.RecoveryAttachError
histogram.summary: SQLite error code from failed ATTACH in sql::Recovery::Init().

histogram.name: Sqlite.RecoveryEvents
histogram.summary: Records specific failure and success cases in sql::Recovery implementation, to determine which cases warrant further development. This histogram tracks detected errors, some of which may cause multiple results. See recovery.cc for details.

histogram.name: Sqlite.RecoveryHandle
histogram.summary: Error from sqlite3_backup_init() in sql::Recovery.

histogram.name: Sqlite.RecoveryStep
histogram.summary: Error from sqlite3_backup_step() in sql::Recovery.

histogram.name: Sqlite.Stats2
histogram.summary: SQLite failures encountered by //sql code. Intended to be viewed using unique user counts. SQLite errors should be caused by media failures (random variable with fairly low probability) or bad A/V software (not random, but hopefully low enough that we can pretend it is).

histogram.name: Sqlite.Version
histogram.summary: Version of pre-existing database at startup.

histogram.name: SSL.CertificateErrorReportEvent
histogram.summary:
Users can opt in to send reports of certificate validation errors to Google. This records the outcome whenever Chrome sends such a report.
Some certificate validation reports might not be received because proxies, firewalls or other content filters might filter report uploads.

histogram.name: SSL.CertificateErrorReportFailure
histogram.summary: Users can opt in to send reports of certificate validation errors to Google. This records the error code whenever Chrome fails to send such a report.

histogram.name: SSL.ExpectCTReportFailure2
histogram.summary: Sites can opt in to Expect CT, a reporting feature that sends a report whenever a TLS connection does not have valid Certificate Transparency information associated with it. This records the error code when Chrome fails to send an Expect CT report.

histogram.name: SSL.ExpectCTReportSendingAttempt
histogram.summary: Sites can opt in to Expect CT, a reporting feature that sends a report whenever a TLS connection does not have valid Certificate Transparency information associated with it. This metric fires whenever Chrome attempts to send an Expect CT report.

histogram.name: SSL.InsecureContent
histogram.summary: Keeps track of various insecure content events, such as loading an HTTP script from an HTTPS page.

histogram.name: SSL.MixedContentShown
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by SSL.MixedContentShown2, which does not log the *WithCertErrors buckets when the main frame load also has certificate errors. Removed in 03/2021.
histogram.summary: Tracks when mixed content is displayed or run.

histogram.name: SSL.MixedContentShown2
histogram.summary: Tracks when mixed content is loaded, differentiated by blockable, optionally-blockable mixed content, and mixed forms. Also tracks when a site with a valid certificate loads a subresource with an invalid certificate. Replaced SSL.MixedContentShown.

histogram.name: SSL.NonWebbyMixedContentLoaded
histogram.summary: Tracks when mixed content is loaded from a "non-webby" URL, e.g. an external protocol. The security of such URLs is unknown, but they are exempt from mixed content UI treatment because they don't usually return data to the browser. This histogram tracks how often such content is loaded so that we can decide whether to block such resources unless an enterprise policy is enabled.

histogram.name: SSORecallPromo.AccountsAvailable
histogram.summary: Number of accounts available for Single Sign On with the current device, recorded at the time the SSO Promo is shown.

histogram.name: SSORecallPromo.PromoAction
histogram.summary: Action the user takes when the Single Sign On promotion is shown.

histogram.name: SSORecallPromo.PromoSeenCount
histogram.summary: Number of times the promotion has been seen on the current device.

histogram.name: StackSamplingProfiler.MetadataSlotsUsed
histogram.summary: The number of sample metadata item slots used after successfully setting a metadata item. This count reflects both active and inactive metadata items.

histogram.name: Style.InvalidationTime
histogram.summary: Microseconds spent in StyleEngine::InvalidateStyle. Only samples from high resolution timers are recorded.

histogram.name: Style.RebuildLayoutTreeTime
histogram.summary: Microseconds spent in RebuildLayoutTree called from Document::UpdateStyle.

histogram.name: Style.RecalcTime
histogram.summary: Microseconds spent in RecalcStyle called from Document::UpdateStyle.

histogram.name: SubresourceWebBundles.ContentLength
histogram.summary: The value of content length header of a subresource web bundle, or zero if the content-length header is missing.

histogram.name: SubresourceWebBundles.LoadResult
histogram.summary: The result of loading subresource web bundles.

histogram.name: SubresourceWebBundles.MaxMemoryUsagePerProcess
histogram.summary: The max memory usage per renderer process for subresource web bundles which are kept in the network process's memory. Recorded when all the subresource web bundles for the renderer process are released.

histogram.name: SubresourceWebBundles.ReceivedSize
histogram.summary: The received data size of a subresource web bundle. Recorded when received all the body of the subresource web bundle.

histogram.name: Suggestions.FailedRequestErrorCode
histogram.summary: The counts of network error codes encountered by SuggestionsService when an attempt to fetch suggestions from the server fails.

histogram.name: Suggestions.FetchResponseCode
histogram.summary: The counts of HTTP response codes encountered by SuggestionsService when attempting to fetch suggestions from the server.

histogram.name: Suggestions.FetchSuccessLatency
histogram.summary: The latency of a SuggestionsService fetch that results in a success response.

histogram.name: Suggestions.LocalBlacklistSize
histogram.summary: Number of URLs present in the Suggestions local blacklist when the Suggestions service is created.

histogram.name: Suggestions.ResponseState
histogram.summary: The counts of response states (such as empty or invalid) encountered by SuggestionsService when attempting to fetch suggestions from the server.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.ExtensionEnablement
histogram.summary: Records supervised users trying to enable or disable extensions. Enabled count increments when the supervised user successfully enables an extension. Disabled count increments when the supervised user successfully disables an extension. Enable attempt failed count increments when the parent has turned off the "Permissions for sites, apps and extensions" toggle and the supervised user tries to enable an extension that requires custodian approval or has a permissions increase.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.ExtensionInstallDialog
histogram.summary: Records the actions of supervised users on the Extension Install Dialog. Opened count increments when the supervised user tries to install an extension from the Chrome Web Store and launches the Extension Install Dialog. Asked Parent count increments when the supervised user clicks "Ask a parent". Child Canceled count increments when the supervised user clicks "Cancel".

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.ExtensionInstallDialog.AskedParentUserTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time in milliseconds for the child user to click the "Ask a parent" button on the Extension Install Dialog.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.ExtensionInstallDialog.ChildCanceledUserTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time in milliseconds for the child user to click the "Cancel" button on the Extension Install Dialog.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.Extensions2
histogram.summary: Records the progress of supervised users as they try to install Chrome extensions. Extension Approval Granted count increments when the custodian initially grants approval to install the extension. Permissions Increase Granted count increments when the supervised user approves a newer version of an existing extension with increased permissions. Extension Approval Removed count increments when the supervised user removes an extension.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.ExtensionsMayRequestPermissions
histogram.summary: Records the state of the "Permissions for sites, apps and extensions" toggle. When parents/custodians have the toggle enabled, supervised users may install extensions with parent/custodian approval, and can approve permission updates by themselves. Otherwise, supervised users cannot install extensions and cannot approve permission updates. If the toggle is disabled and an extension has permissions updates, the extension would remain force-disabled. The Disabled count increments when the parent flips the toggle off, and increments twice if the supervised user logs in while the toggle is in the off state. The Enabled count increments when the parent flips the toggle on, and increments twice if the supervised user logs in while the toggle is in the on state. While the double counting upon logging in is less than ideal, at least the counts are balanced relative to each other.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.ParentPermissionDialog
histogram.summary: Records the actions of parents on the Parent Permission Dialog. Opened count increments when the Parent Permission Dialog first opens. Parent Approved count increments when the parent successfully types their password and approves the extension. Parent Canceled count increments when the parent cancels the dialog, denying the supervised user's attempt to enable the extension. Failed count increments when there was some sort of failure in the Parent Permission Dialog. No Parent Error count increments when the supervised user doesn't have any associated parent email addresses for asking approval. Note that this error also increments the Failed count.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.ParentPermissionDialog.FailedUserTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time in milliseconds after opening for the Parent Permission Dialog to fail due to various reasons.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.ParentPermissionDialog.ParentApprovedUserTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time in milliseconds for the parent to successfully type their password and approve the extension.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.ParentPermissionDialog.ParentCanceledUserTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time in milliseconds for the parent to cancel the Parent Permission Dialog.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.PerAppTimeLimits.AppsWithTimeLimit
histogram.summary: The count of applications with time limit set by parents. Recorded once per PerAppTimeLimit policy change.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.PerAppTimeLimits.BlockedAppsCount
histogram.summary: The count of applications blocked by parents. It only applies to ARC++ applications. Recorded once per PerAppTimeLimit policy change.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.PerAppTimeLimits.Engagement
histogram.summary: Per-App Time Limits feature engagement measured by the number of apps with time limits set for child user. Reported at the beginning of each user session.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.PerAppTimeLimits.PolicyChangeCount
histogram.summary: The total number of PerAppTimeLimits policy changes seen in a session. Recorded once at the end of the session.

histogram.name: Supervision.ParentAccessCode.Action
histogram.summary: Action originated in parent access code dialog. Logged every time the action happens.

histogram.name: Supervision.ParentAccessCode.Usage
histogram.summary: The context in which parent access code was used. Logged every time the new parent access dialog is shown.

histogram.name: Supervision.ParentAccessCode.ValidationResult.{Action}
histogram.summary: The result of the parent access code validation for {Action} action. Logged every time the code is validated from the parent access dialog.

histogram.name: Supervision.StatusReport.Event
histogram.summary: The event that triggered status report for supervised account.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.ConflictResolutionPolicy
histogram.summary: Overridden conflict resolution policy of Sync FileSystem API. Recorded for each API call to override the policy.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.Database.Open
histogram.summary: The result of opening the Sync FileSystem backend database.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.MetadataNumber
histogram.summary: The number of cached backing remote file metadata in the Sync FileSystem database. Recorded at the initialization phase of Sync FileSystem.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.RegisteredAppNumber
histogram.summary: The number of Chrome Apps that uses Sync FileSystem with V2 backend. Recorded at the initialization phase of Sync FileSystem.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.RegisterOriginResult
histogram.summary: The result of the registration of Chrome App to Sync FileSystem.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.RegisterOriginTime
histogram.summary: Time elapsed to register a Chrome App to SyncFilesystem. Recorded for each registration request by apps.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.TrackerDB.Open
histogram.summary: The result of opening the Sync FileSystem tracker database.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.TrackerNumber
histogram.summary: The number of the directory tree node that maps backing files to local files in the Sync FileSystem database. Recorded at the initialization phase of SyncFileSystem.

histogram.name: Tablet.AppDrag.EndWindowState
histogram.summary: Drag an app window from top in tablet mode will result in different window states. Logged when the app drag ended to record the window end state.

histogram.name: Tablet.AppWindowDrag.CountOfPerUserSession
histogram.summary: The number of the action that drag an app window from top in tablet mode. Logged when the TabletModeController is destructed, which means the user session is ended.

histogram.name: Tablet.AppWindowDrag.InSplitView.CountOfPerUserSession
histogram.summary: The number of the action that drag an app window from top in tablet mode when splitview is active. Logged when the TabletModeController is destructed, which means the user session is ended.

histogram.name: Tablet.CountOfVolumeAdjustType
histogram.summary: The number of each volume adjust type in tablet mode. Logged when starts volume adjust while in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Tablet.TabDrag.CountOfPerUserSession
histogram.summary: The number of the action that drag a tab of the browser window in tablet mode. Logged when the TabletModeController is destructed, which means the user session is ended.

histogram.name: Tablet.TabDrag.DragType
histogram.summary: The type of a tab drag done in tablet mode. Logged when start to drag a tab of the browser window in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Tablet.TabDrag.InSplitView.CountOfPerUserSession
histogram.summary: The number of the action that drag a tab of the browser window in tablet mode when splitview is active. Logged when the TabletModeController is destructed, which means the user session is ended.

histogram.name: Tablet.WindowDrag.DragEndEventType
histogram.summary: The type of the window (app window or tab strip) drag end event in tablet mode. Logged when the window drag in tablet mode ended.

histogram.name: Tablet.WindowDrag.OpenedWindowsNumber
histogram.summary: The number of windows in overview when dragging a window from top in tablet mode. Logged when start the window drag and overview has been opened behind.

histogram.name: TaskQueueManager.ActiveQueuesCount
histogram.summary: Used to track the number of active task queues in the task queue manager. Reported every time a task is selected for execution.

histogram.name: TaskQueueSelector.TaskServicedPerSelectorLogic
histogram.summary: Used to track the number of tasks serviced due to starvation versus the number of tasks serviced due to priroity. Incremented whenever a task queue is selected to service.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor.ElementIdFragmentFound
histogram.summary: Whether an element-id based fragment was found in the document. Counted only when a fragment was specified and it wasn't parsed into a |targetText| style anchor.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor.LinkOpenSource
histogram.summary: Recorded for every navigation to a link with a valid text fragment selector (e.g. #:=:text=SELECTOR). Indicates source type that navigation originated from. It only know about search engines that come from the pre-populated list installed with Chrome. If the user uses a search engine not on the list, it will be recorded as Unknown. This is even true if the user have a custom search engine. These custom search engines can be created by hand or auto-generated. In either case, it's not going to count as a search engine. Also, it only checks to see if the *referrer* is from a domain associated with search engine. If someone posts a link somewhere on a web site that happens to have a search engine known to Google and that links includes the fragment tokens, then if a user clicks that link, it'll look like it came from a search engine even thought they did not.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.AmbiguousMatch
histogram.summary:
Whether we found multiple matches for a selector. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.DidScrollIntoView
histogram.summary:
Whether the page did a non-zero scroll in order to scroll the match into view. Only recorded if we found a match and scrolled it into view. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.DirectiveLength
histogram.summary:
The raw length of the directive in the URL (e.g. spaces count as the three characters '%20'), regardless of how many text= terms there are. Recorded if there was a text directive, regardless of whether a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.EndTextLength
histogram.summary:
The length of the end parameter, in the case of a range match. Only recorded if a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.ExactTextLength
histogram.summary:
The length of the matched text, in the case of an exact match. Only recorded if a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.ListItemMatch
histogram.summary:
Whether the match was within a list item. Only recorded for exact text fragments and only if a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.MatchRate
histogram.summary:
The percentage of selectors for which a match was found in the document. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.Parameters
histogram.summary:
An enum indicating which parameters were specified in the text fragment anchor. Only recorded if a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.RangeMatchLength
histogram.summary:
The length of the matched text, in the case of a range match. Only recorded if a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.ScrollCancelled
histogram.summary:
Whether the scroll into view was cancelled by a user gesture or programmatic scroll. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.SelectorCount
histogram.summary:
The number of selectors in the text fragment anchor if it is present. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.SpansMultipleBlocks
histogram.summary:
Whether or not a range-based text fragment match crosses any block boundaries. That is, the start and end of the range are in different blocks or in the same block but contain an intervening block. Only recorded for range-based (start,end) text fragments. Only recorded on successful match.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.StartTextLength
histogram.summary:
The length of the start parameter, in the case of a range match. Only recorded if a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.TableCellMatch
histogram.summary:
Whether the match was within a table cell. Only recorded for exact text fragments and only if a match was found. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.TimeToScrollIntoView
histogram.summary:
The time between creating the TextFragmentAnchor (i.e. when it is parsed) and scrolling the target into view. Only recorded if there is a match and we scroll it into view. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: TextFragmentAnchor{TextFragmentSource}.TimeToScrollToTop
histogram.summary:
The time between scrolling a match into view and the user scrolling back to the top of the page. Used as a signal for whether a match was useful. Only recorded if a match is scrolled into view and the user subsequently scrolled back to the top of the page. Recorded when TextFragmentAnchor finishes searching once the page is loaded.
Recorded from text fragment links followed from {TextFragmentSource}.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Certificates.Microsoft
histogram.summary: The total number of certificates for modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process that are signed by Microsoft. A catalog counts as a single certificate, and may refer to many modules. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Certificates.Total
histogram.summary: The total number of certificates for modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process. A catalog counts as a single certificate, and may refer to many modules. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.GetDriveLetterPathFound
histogram.summary: Records whether an equivalent driver letter path was found for a device path.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Heartbeat.BlockedModulesCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of modules that were blocked from loading into the browser process by the third-party DLL blocking feature. This is recorded every 5 minutes.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Heartbeat.PrintingWorkaround.BlockingEnabled
histogram.summary: Records whether or not Chrome is still blocking third-party DLLs. This is a bit that turns to false when the in-process printing is invoked. Recorded every 5 minutes.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Heartbeat.UniqueBlockedModulesCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of unique modules that were blocked from loading into the browser process by the third-party DLL blocking feature. This is recorded every 5 minutes.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.InputMethodEditorsCount
histogram.summary: The number of registered input method editors found on the user's machine. This is emitted shortly after startup when the IME enumeration takes place.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.InstalledApplications.GetDataTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it took to gather the list of installed third-party programs and their install location or components.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.InstalledApplications.GotUserSidString
histogram.summary: Records whether retrieving the current user SID was successful.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Loaded
histogram.summary: The total number of third-party modules (neither Microsoft nor Google) that are loaded in the browser process. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.NotLoaded
histogram.summary: The total number of third-party modules (neither Microsoft nor Google) that are not yet loaded in the browser process, but may potentially be (shell extensions, for example). Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Signed
histogram.summary: The total number of signed modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Signed.Catalog
histogram.summary: The total number of modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process that are signed via a catalog. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Signed.Microsoft
histogram.summary: The total number of modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process that are signed by Microsoft. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Total
histogram.summary: The total number of modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Modules.Unsigned
histogram.summary: The total number of unsigned modules loaded (or potentially loaded) into the browser process. Measured shortly after startup. Windows only.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.ShellExtensionsCount3
histogram.summary: The number of registered shell extensions found on the user's machine. This is emitted shortly after startup when the shell extensions enumeration is done. Doesn't count duplicates.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.TimeDateStampObtained
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the TimeDateStamp for a loaded module was successfully obtained.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.Uninstallable
histogram.summary: Records whether or not a loaded third party module could be uninstalled using the Windows Apps & Features page.

histogram.name: ThreadWatcher.ResponseTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes indicated thread to respond with a pong message for a ping message from WatchDog thread.

histogram.name: ThreadWatcher.ResponsiveThreads
histogram.summary: This is the total number of watched threads that are responding when we got no response from the watched thread.

histogram.name: ThreadWatcher.Unresponsive
histogram.summary: This is the total unresponsive time since last pong message for the indicated thread when we got no response from the watched thread.

histogram.name: ThreadWatcher.UnresponsiveThreads
histogram.summary: This is the total number of watched threads that are not responding when we got no response from the watched thread.

histogram.name: Thumbnails.CopyFromSurfaceTime
histogram.summary: While taking a screenshot of the current tab for use as a thumbnail, the time it took to copy the tab's contents into a bitmap.

histogram.name: Thumbnails.Gradient.ImageDetectionTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes to detect whether a thumbnail requires a gradient overlay. This is run when thumbnails are downloaded for content suggestions, as they load and the result is cached for future use. It is Android specific.

histogram.name: Thumbnails.Gradient.ImageRequiresGradient
histogram.summary: Whether a thumbnail used for a suggestions image requires a gradient to be overlaid to not fade into the background. It applies to the thumbnails used for content suggestions and is Android specific.

histogram.name: Thumbnails.ProcessBitmapTime
histogram.summary: While taking a screenshot of the current tab for use as a thumbnail, the time it took to post-process the captured bitmap.

histogram.name: TileManager.ExceededMemoryBudget
histogram.summary: Measures whether the tile manager exceeded the hard GPU memory budget (OOMed). Recorded each time the tile manager assigns GPU memory to tiles.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.Event
histogram.summary: Events in TimeZoneRequest.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: Http response codes in TimeZoneRequest.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.ResponseFailureTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of the first API request and the time the final (failed) response was recorded. Includes all retries.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.ResponseSuccessTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of the first API request and the time the final (successfull) response was recorded. Includes all retries.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.Result
histogram.summary: Result of TimeZoneRequest.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.Retries
histogram.summary: Number of retries until the final response was recorded.

histogram.name: Toolbar.ChromeLabs.{State}LabAction
histogram.summary:
Chrome Labs features user-facing experiments through a button in the toolbar.
This metric tracks which experiment (also called lab in the context of Chrome Labs) a user selects {State} for. This histogram is emitted to when {State} is selected in the combobox of the ChromeLabs dialog.

histogram.name: Toolbar.Menu.NewIncognitoTabPresentationDuration
histogram.summary: The number of millseconds between the user requesting a new incognito tab, e.g. by tapping the New Incognito Tab entry in the main tools menu, and it completing its animation on screen.

histogram.name: Toolbar.ShowToolsMenuResponsiveness
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between the event that triggers the presentation of the tools menu (the main menu of actions accessed from the toolbar), and the actual appearance of the menu on screen. Includes the animation duration.

histogram.name: Toolbar.TabSwitcher.NewIncognitoTabPresentationDuration
histogram.summary: The number of millseconds between the user requesting a new incognito tab, from within the tab switcher, e.g. by tapping the New Tab button from the tab switcher UI, and it completing its animation on screen.

histogram.name: Toolbar.TabSwitcher.NewTabPresentationDuration
histogram.summary: The number of millseconds between the user requesting a new tab, from within the tab switcher UI, e.g. by tapping the New Tab button from the tab switcher UI, and it completing its animation on screen.

histogram.name: TouchBar.Default.Metrics
histogram.summary: Tracks the usage of the default touch bar buttons.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Acceleration.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad acceleration setting changes by the user. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Acceleration.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad acceleration setting on startup. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Device
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad device state.

histogram.name: Touchpad.NaturalScroll.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad natural scroll setting changes by the user. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.NaturalScroll.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad natural scroll setting on startup. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting changes by the user. This replaces the old Touchpad.Sensitivity.Changed metric. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting on startup. This replaces the old Touchpad.Sensitivity.Started metric. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.ScrollAcceleration
histogram.summary: Whether touchpad scroll acceleration is enabled. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.ScrollSensitivity
histogram.summary: Touchpad scroll sensitivity value. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapDragging.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapDragging setting changes by the user. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapDragging.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapDragging setting on startup. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapToClick.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapToClick setting changes by the user. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapToClick.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapToClick setting changes by the user. Only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: TouchScreen.MissedTOUCHEVENTF_UP
histogram.summary:
Recorded when a touch event excludes an active touch (a touch-id/dwId that previously generated a TOUCHEVENTF_DOWN, and has not since generated a TOUCHEVENTF_UP). Chromium generates a simulated event to maintain consistency/correctness. Only recorded on Windows.
This workaround will be removed once usage drops off. See https://crbug.com/811273 for details.

histogram.name: Touchscreen.TouchEventsEnabled
histogram.summary:
Tracks whether Touch Event Feature Detection is enabled. This is based on the touch events enabled flag and the presence of a touchscreen.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.
histogram.details: NOTE: This metric was incorrectly recorded on Chrome OS for versions 42 through 45, see http://crbug.com/499476 for more details. As of http://crbug.com/644318, we changed the internal name to TouchEventFeatureDetection, but we still keep the old histogram name here to keep consistensy.

histogram.name: TPM.EarlyResetDuringCommand
histogram.summary: Reported at boot if the previous boot session was interrupted in the middle of a TPM command during the first 30 seconds of uptime.

histogram.name: Tracing.Background.FinalizationDisallowedReason
histogram.summary: Reason why background tracing finalization was not allowed. Also see "Tracing.Background.ScenarioState" metric, which records the total number of times finalization was allowed and not allowed.

histogram.name: Tracing.Background.FinalizingTraceSizeInKB
histogram.summary: The size, in kilobytes, of a finalized trace ready to be uploaded.

histogram.name: Tracing.Background.NetworkConnectionTypeWhenStarted
histogram.summary: Connection type of the network used to determine the trace buffer size, when background tracing was triggered. Recorded only on Android.

histogram.name: Tracing.Background.NetworkConnectionTypeWhenUploaded
histogram.summary: Connection type of the network used to determine the trace upload limit, when background tracing upload was started. Recorded only on Android.

histogram.name: Tracing.Background.ScenarioState
histogram.summary: Records state of the Background Tracing system, from when scenarios are attempted to be activated until they're completed (successfully or failed)

histogram.name: Tracing.ProducerHostInitializationResult
histogram.summary: Whenever a producer connects to the tracing service, records the success/failure result of the connection.

histogram.name: Tracing.SharedBufferIsValid
histogram.summary: Records success or failure of creating the shared buffer in ProducerClient::InitSharedMemoryIfNeeded()

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.ClearDataDialogOnClearAppDataAccepted
histogram.summary: Emits true if the user went to site settings from the dialog that is shown after a Trusted Web Activity client app has had its data cleared.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.ClearDataDialogOnUninstallAccepted
histogram.summary: Emits true if the user went to site settings from the dialog that is shown after a Trusted Web Activity client app has been uninstalled.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.DelegatedNotificationSmallIconFallback
histogram.summary: Logs which kind of fallback for notification small icon was used for Trusted Web Activity notification delegation.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.LocationDelegationEnrolled
histogram.summary: When a site running in Truested Web Activity is accessing geolocation, records whether the last tracked focused Trusted Web Activity client app enrolled location delegation.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.LocationPermissionChanged
histogram.summary: When a Trusted Web Activity client app's location permission is changed, record the previous state and new stase.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.LocationPermissionRequestIsGranted
histogram.summary: Records the boolean result (granted or not) from requesting a Trusted Web Activity client app's location permission.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.LocationUpdateErrorCode
histogram.summary: Records an error code when we get a new location update or location error from the Trusted Web Activity client app. Record "LocationUpdateError.NONE" (value = 0) if there is no error and the geoposition is valid.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.QualityEnforcementViolation
histogram.summary: When Trusted Web Activity launches or navigates to a site that violate the quality criteria, records the violation type.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.QualityEnforcementViolation.Crashed
histogram.summary:
When Trusted Web Activity launches or navigates to a site that violate the quality criteria, and the CCT will be closed, records the violation type.
This is similar to TrustedWebActivity.QualityEnforcementViolation but only records when the violation will close the CCT.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.ShareTargetRequest
histogram.summary: Recorded when data is shared via a Trusted Web Activity.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.SplashScreenShown
histogram.summary: Records whether or not a splash screen has been shown when launching a Trusted Web Activity.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.TimeInVerifiedOrigin.V2
histogram.summary: Time spent in a verified origin until navigating to an unverified one or pausing the Trusted Web Activity.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.TimeOutOfVerifiedOrigin.V2
histogram.summary: Time spent out of verified origins until navigating back to a verified one or pausing the Trusted Web Activity.

histogram.name: UI.DeviceScale
histogram.summary: The device scales available on the system at startup. A system may report more than one if it has multiple displays with varying device scales. Only logged on Windows.

histogram.name: UncompressAndParseSkiaVectorAsset
histogram.summary: Records the time spent in uncompressing a gzipped animation file.

histogram.name: UnifiedConsent.MakeSearchesAndBrowsingBetter.OnStartup
histogram.summary: State of the user settings for making searches and browsing better, recorded at startup.

histogram.name: UnifiedConsent.SyncAndGoogleServicesSettings.AfterAdvancedOptIn.SyncDataTypesOff
histogram.summary: All *off* sync data types are recorded when the user confirmed the sync setup after going through the advanced opt-in flow.

histogram.name: UpdateClient.BackgroundDownloaderJobs
histogram.summary: The number of download jobs found in the Windows BITS queue. This value is expected to be zero in most cases, or a small number otherwise. Large values indicate a problem with the job creation or clean up code. The metric is recorded before a new BITS job is created and inserted into BITS queue.

histogram.name: UpdateClient.BackgroundDownloaderNewJob
histogram.summary: True if a new BITS job was created to download the url, or false, if an existing job was found in the BITS queue. The metric is recorded when the component updater background downloader is asked to download a CRX.

histogram.name: UpgradeDetector.DaysBeforeUpgrade
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed from an update being visible to the browser and the browser being restarted or quit.

histogram.name: UpgradeDetector.NotificationStage
histogram.summary: Tracks the upgrade notification stage. This is recorded with every UMA log.

histogram.name: UpgradeDetector.PollType
histogram.summary: Records the type of poll that first detected an installed version change. Note that a browser that is running while multiple updates are applied will only record this metric once.

histogram.name: UpgradeDetector.RollbackReason
histogram.summary:
Tracks what is the reason we're doing a rollback instead of an update (going to a more stable channel or admin-initiated enterprise rollback). We're showing different notifications depending on the reason.
Sent when the device finished installing the rollback image, shows the notification and is waiting for reboot.
This metric is specific to Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Uptime.ChromeExecToLoginPromptVisibleAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when Chrome is started, and when the login prompt is again visible after a logout. This statistic is only collected when preceeded by a logout.

histogram.name: Uptime.DBusCrash
histogram.summary: The system uptime on Chrome OS when the dbus-daemon process crashes, resulting in a reboot.

histogram.name: Uptime.LogoutToLoginPromptVisible
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between initiating a logout and the next time the login prompt is visible again. This statistic is not collected if the machine is shutdown between the logout initiation and the prompt becoming visible.

histogram.name: Uptime.LogoutToUIStopAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when a logout is initiated and the UI has stopped (and Chrome has exited) during the logout process. This statistic is not collected if the logout is part of a restart or shutdown.

histogram.name: Uptime.OtherProcessesTerminatedToChromeExecAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when all user-associated processes have been terminated during the logout process and when Chrome is started again to show the login screen. Since at least ChromeOS M62, equivalent to Uptime.XTerminatedToChromeExecAfterLogout.

histogram.name: Uptime.UIStopToProcessesTerminatedAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when the UI has stopped (Chrome has exited), and when all other associated processes have been terminated during the logout process. This statistic is not collected if the logout is part of a restart or shutdown.

histogram.name: UsageStats.Events
histogram.summary: Android: count of Usage Stats events. Recorded as these events occur; e.g. when a domain is associated with a token, or a site is suspended.

histogram.name: UserImage.LoggedIn
histogram.summary: Distribution of the default images that existing users login with (Chrome OS). One sample is taken each time the user logs in.

histogram.name: UserImage.ProfileDownloadTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to download user's profile picture.

histogram.name: UserManager.LoginUserType
histogram.summary: The number of users of different types that log in to the system (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UserManager.LogoutToLoginDelay
histogram.summary: The time between one regular user logging out and a different regular user logging in (Chrome OS). Delays above thirty minutes or which span system reboots or non-regular-user logins are not reported.

histogram.name: UserManager.ProfileEverInitializedMigrationCompleted
histogram.summary: Whether the profile_ever_initialized() user attribute migration has completed for the current user.

histogram.name: UserManager.UserTypeChanged
histogram.summary: This is logged when new user type reported by Gaia is different from the old one (for existing user).

histogram.name: UserSessionManager.RestoreOnCrash.AccountIdValid
histogram.summary: The result of restoring account id on Chrome restart after crash on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Vibration.Context
histogram.summary: Records instances of navigator.vibrate. Includes whether or not it comes with a user gesture, same-origin subframe or cross-origin subframe.

histogram.name: VideoPlayer.CastAPIExtensionStatus
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Video Player: the results of the cast API extension load. This is recorded after the initialization of the extension is finished.

histogram.name: VideoPlayer.CastedVideoLength
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Video Player: the length of casted video (in seconds).

histogram.name: VideoPlayer.NumberOfCastDevices
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Video Player: the number of cast devices. This is recorded when the cast extension finishes the discovery.

histogram.name: VideoPlayer.NumberOfOpenedFiles
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Video Player: the number of files being opened on launch.

histogram.name: VideoPlayer.PlayType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Video Player: type of playback (eg. local play, cast). This is recorded when a video starts playing.

histogram.name: Viewport.DidScalePage
histogram.summary: Tracks the proportion of non-mobile optimized (i.e. zoom disabled or layout width matches viewport) page views that had a user-initiated page scale (e.g. pinch-zoom, double-tap). Recorded on navigation to a new page - on Android only.

histogram.name: Viewport.MaxPageScale
histogram.summary: Tracks the maximum scale factor that a user has scaled to over the lifetime of the page. The scale is counted at pinch end (e.g. zooming to 300% and back out to 150% in one gesture would count as 150%). Reported only on non-mobile optimized pages (i.e. zoom disabled or layout width matches viewport) which have had a page scale changing gesture. Recorded on navigation to a new page - on Android only.

histogram.name: Viewport.MetaTagType
histogram.summary: The viewport meta tag type seen on each page load. Only recorded on Android. Recorded when the page finishes loading.

histogram.name: Viewport.OverviewZoom
histogram.summary: The screen width as a percentage of viewport width (i.e. zoom at which we can see the whole page). Only recorded on Android and for viewport meta tags with constant width.

histogram.name: ViewResourceAdapter.GetBitmapInterval
histogram.summary: The interval between ViewResourceAdapter#getBitmap calls.

histogram.name: VirtualKeyboard.ControllerStateTransition
histogram.summary: An integer representing a state transition from x to y in the form of x * 1000 + y. If the transition is not expected, the value is negated. For example an expected transition from SHOWING (= 2) to SHOWN (= 1) is denoted as 2001, and an unexpected transition from SHOWING to SHOWING is denoted as -2002. See KeyboardControllerState for the correspondence between the number and the enum.

histogram.name: VirtualKeyboard.InitLatency.FirstLoad
histogram.summary: Latency of the keyboard being loaded for the first time.

histogram.name: VirtualKeyboard.KeyboardControlEvent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: A count of various control events that can occur on the virtual keyboard, such as showing and hiding.

histogram.name: VirtualKeyboard.LingeringIntermediateState
histogram.summary: Records whenever an intermediate keyboard state has been active for longer than a fixed timeout.

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.OverlayNumProposedCandidates
histogram.summary: A count of the number of proposed overlay candidates available for overlay selection. Recorded every time a frame is rendered by the display compositor.

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.OverlayQuadMaterial
histogram.summary: Quad material for current promoted overlay, per frame. Recorded every time a frame is rendered by the display compositor.

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.OverlayStrategy
histogram.summary: Overlay strategies used to promote Hardware Overlays, per frame. Recorded every time a frame is rendered by the display compositor.

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.OverlaySwitchInterval
histogram.summary: The time, in milliseconds, since the change in overlay selection. Recorded every time a frame is rendered by the display compositor.

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.RootDamageRect.Overlay
histogram.summary: Any root damage excluding overlay damage in the current frame?

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.RootDamageRect.Underlay
histogram.summary: The root damage type excluding underlay damage in the current frame.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.I420.CaptureDuration
histogram.summary: The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl sent a request for an I420 readback until the result comes back and ReadI420Planes successfully finishes.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.I420.CaptureSucceeded
histogram.summary: Whether an I420 readback initiated by FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl succeeded.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.RGBA.CaptureDuration
histogram.summary: The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl sent a request for an RGBA readback until the result comes back and ReadRGBAPlane successfully finishes.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.RGBA.CaptureSucceeded
histogram.summary: Whether an RGBA readback initiated by FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl succeeded.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.AssistantActionPerformed{Source}
histogram.summary: Android: The action performed by Assistant upon being invoked during a voice search initiated via the {Source}, such as transcription of a voice search query or translation of the current page. This is recorded after an Assistant intent has completed successfully.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.AssistantIntent.TranslateExtrasAttached
histogram.summary: Android: Whether Translate extras were successfully attached to an Assistant intent. This is recorded just before the intent is sent to Assistant, and is only recorded if the Translate extras are enabled.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.AudioPermissionEvent
histogram.summary: Android: The events related to granting or denying audio permission for system level transcription (as opposite to Assistant). Will be logged each time non-Assistant voice recognition is triggered with a mic button click.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.DismissedEventSource
histogram.summary: Android: The source of a dismissed voice search, such as omnibox or NTP. This is recorded after the dismissed intent returns to Chrome.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.DismissedEventTarget
histogram.summary: Android: The target of a dismissed voice search, such as the system transcription dialog or Assistant. This is recorded after the dismissed intent returns to Chrome.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.FailureEventSource
histogram.summary: Android: The source of a failed voice search, such as omnibox or NTP. This is recorded after any intent failure, which could occur before an intent is sent (if the send fails) or after the intent returns unsuccessfully. It will only be recorded once.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.FailureEventTarget
histogram.summary: Android: The target of a failed voice search, such as the system transcription dialog or Assistant. This is recorded after any intent failure, which could occur before an intent is sent (if the send fails) or after the intent returns unsuccessfully. It will only be recorded once.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.FinishEventSource
histogram.summary: Android: The source of a successful voice search, such as omnibox or NTP. This is recorded immediately after the successful intent returns to Chrome.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.FinishEventTarget
histogram.summary: Android: The target of a successful voice search, such as the system transcription dialog or Assistant. This is recorded immediately after the successful intent returns to Chrome.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.IllegalContextRequest
histogram.summary: Counts the number of requests to retrieve voice interaction context when no user interaction is initiated.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.QueryDuration.Android
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes between the user clicking the mic and chrome receiving the transcribed voice query. This is recorded after an Assistant intent has completed successfully.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.QueryDuration.Android.Target.{Target}
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes between the user clicking the mic and chrome receiving the transcribed voice query. This is recorded after an Assistant intent has completed successfully. This histogram is limited to intents sent to {Target}. See VoiceInteraction.QueryDuration.Android for the total count across all targets.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.QueryDuration.Android{Action}
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes between the user clicking the mic and chrome receiving the intent response for {Action} actions. This is recorded after an Assistant intent has completed successfully. These per-action variants are recorded only when non-transcription actions are enabled. See VoiceInteraction.QueryDuration.Android for the total count that includes clients with non-transcription actions disabled.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.StartEventSource
histogram.summary: Android: The source of a voice search start event, such as omnibox or NTP. This is recorded immediately before the voice transcription intent is sent.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.StartEventTarget
histogram.summary: Android: The target of a voice search start event, such as the system transcription dialog or Assistant. This is recorded immediately before the voice transcription intent is sent.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.UnexpectedResultSource
histogram.summary: Android: The source of an incoming result that doesn't align with an outgoing request from Chrome. This is recorded when the extraneous intent response is received.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.UnexpectedResultTarget
histogram.summary: Android: The target of an intent result that doesn't align with an outgoing request from Chrome. This is recorded when the extraneous intent response is received.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.UserInteractionToRequestArrival
histogram.summary: Records the time between user interaction and the actual request arrival.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.VoiceResultConfidenceValue
histogram.summary: Android: Records the confidence value of a successful voice search as a percentage. This is recorded when the voice intent returns successfully.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.VoiceResultConfidenceValue.{Target}
histogram.summary: Android: Records the confidence value of a successful voice search as a percentage, limited to intents sent to {Target}. This is recorded when the voice intent returns successfully.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.VoiceSearchResult
histogram.summary: Android: Records whether the voice search produced results. This is recorded when the voice intent returns successfully.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.VoiceSearchResult.{Target}
histogram.summary: Android: Records whether the voice search produced results, limited to intents sent to {Target}. This is recorded when the voice intent returns successfully.

histogram.name: VRFreNotComplete
histogram.summary: Whether the user had been through the FRE when Chrome is launched in VR mode.

histogram.name: VRSessionTime
histogram.summary: The duration of the VR session. Logged when a new disjoint session has begun, or when the session has ended in a non-continuable way.

histogram.name: VRSessionVideoCount
histogram.summary: Number of videos watched in a VR session. Logged when a new disjoint session has begun, or when the session has ended in a non-continuable way.

histogram.name: VRSessionVideoTime
histogram.summary: The duration of a single session spent watching video in VR. Logged when a new disjoint session has begun, or when the session has ended in a non-continuable way.

histogram.name: VRViewerType
histogram.summary: The type of headset being used for VR.

histogram.name: Web.CurrentOriginEqualsLastCommittedOrigin
histogram.summary: [iOS] Reports URL matches between the return value from the WebState's GetLastCommittedURL and GetCurrentURL methods. It is expected the origins will be equal to confirm that GetCurrentURL can now be replaced with GetLastCommittedURL. This will be called each time WebStateImpl:: GetCurrentURL(URLVerificationTrustLevel* trust_level) is called, which is an old method of obtaining the url and trust level. The trust level was only relevant with UIWebView, so this method is only called from code which has not yet been updated since UIWebView was removed.

histogram.name: Webapp.AddToHomescreenDialog.Timeout
histogram.summary: Records the number of milliseconds that the add to homescreen dialog required to check installability eligibility.

histogram.name: Webapp.AddToHomescreenMediator.AppTypeToMenuEntry
histogram.summary: Keeps track of what verbiage was shown in the App menu versus what was actually installed.

histogram.name: Webapp.CheckServiceWorker.Status
histogram.summary: Records the result of the check if a PWA has a service worker with a fetch event handler when the CheckOfflineCapability feature is disabled. When the feature is enabled, records the result of the check if a PWA supports offline pages with a service worker.

histogram.name: Webapp.CheckServiceWorker.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time to complete the check if a PWA has a service worker with a fetch event handler when the CheckOfflineCapability feature is disabled. When the feature is enabled, records the time to complete the check if a PWA supports offline pages with a service worker.

histogram.name: WebApp.Engagement
histogram.summary: The type of engagement (navigation, user input, etc.) which led to an accumulation in site engagement within a web app window or tab. Should be collected for a subset of SiteEngagementService.EngagementType, which is triggered for all browsing contexts. Recorded at the time of engagement accumulation (e.g., when mouse is clicked).

histogram.name: WebApp.Icon.HttpStatusCodeClassOnCreate
histogram.summary: The HTTP status code class returned for each icon loaded during a WebApp's creation. See corresponding Extensions.BookmarkApp.Icon.HttpStatusCodeClassOnCreate histogram for legacy extension-based system. Recorded when WebAppDataRetriever starts downloading icons.

histogram.name: WebApp.Icon.HttpStatusCodeClassOnSync
histogram.summary: The HTTP status code class returned for each icon loaded when syncing a WebApp. See Extensions.BookmarkApp.Icon.HttpStatusCodeClassOnSync histogram for legacy extension-based system. Recorded when WebAppDataRetriever starts downloading icons.

histogram.name: WebApp.Icon.HttpStatusCodeClassOnUpdate
histogram.summary: The HTTP status code class returned for each icon loaded when updating a WebApp. Recorded when WebAppDataRetriever starts downloading icons.

histogram.name: Webapp.Install.DisplayMode2
histogram.summary: Records the display mode (as defined in the Web App Manifest spec) at the install time of a WebApp. Fixes a bug in the data collection for desktop web apps.

histogram.name: Webapp.Install.InstallBounce
