histogram.summary: Records when a web app install bounced for different install sources. A bounce is when the user uninstalls the web app within 1 hour of installing it.

histogram.name: Webapp.Install.InstallEvent
histogram.summary: Records the mechanism and source from which a web app installation was triggered, regardless of whether the installation was successful.

histogram.name: WebApp.InstallConfirmation.CloseReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason that the WebApp install confirmation dialog is closed. This dialog is shown when the user clicks on the 'install' icon in the omnibox for websites that are installable. This metric is intended to give data for an experiment to choose the best install icon.

histogram.name: WebApp.InstallIphPromo.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of user reaction to In Product Help promo for Web App Install.

histogram.name: Webapp.InstallResult
histogram.summary: Records the result code of Web App installs.

histogram.name: Webapp.InstallResultExtensionDisabledReason.System.Profiles
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2020, as the relevant code path is no longer executed after BMO launch.
histogram.summary: Records why System Web App .crx extension is disabled during System Web App installs. Certain properties of the profile might cause Extensions to be disabled as soon as they are installed. For example, kiosk profile might set policies to disable all Extensions, including System Web Apps which are considered Extensions.

histogram.name: Webapp.InstallResultExtensionError.System.Profiles
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2020, as the relevant code path is no longer executed after BMO launch.
histogram.summary: Records .crx extension error code when System Web App install fails.

histogram.name: WebApp.Launcher.LaunchResult
histogram.summary: The result of a Progressive Web App (PWA) launcher's attempt to launch Chrome. Windows-only.

histogram.name: WebApp.Launcher.UpdateResult
histogram.summary: The result of updating a single Progressive Web App (PWA) launcher with the latest version of chrome_pwa_launcher.exe. Windows-only.

histogram.name: WebApp.Migration.UserDisplayModeCleanUp
histogram.summary: The result of deploying a follow up migration after a migration bug (https://crbug.com/1125020) that caused users' web apps to open in a browser tab instead of a standalone window. This follow up migration only runs once at startup for all Chrome profiles. If it fails it will retry until successful on subsequent start ups, metrics are only recorded on success.

histogram.name: WebApp.Mover.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of running the WebAppMover, which runs on Chrome startup. It uninstalls a set of WebApps and then installs a single WebApp as a replacement.

histogram.name: Webapp.NavigationStatus
histogram.summary: Records whether the top-level navigations in standalone Web Apps result in presenting the web content or showing the error page.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.ConfigErrorCount
histogram.summary: Records how many preinstalled web app config files failed to parse as valid JSON with valid fields. See external_web_app_utils.cc ParseConfig(). This is recorded at start up.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.DisabledCount
histogram.summary: Records how many preinstalled web apps configs were disabled for the device. This is recorded at start up.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.EnabledCount
histogram.summary: Records how many preinstalled web apps configs were enabled for the device. This is recorded at start up.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.UninstallAndReplaceCount
histogram.summary: Records how many preinstalled web app installations uninstalled and replaced an old default app (web app or Chrome app). This corresponds to the "uninstall_and_replace" field in preinstalled web app configs.

histogram.name: WebApp.Shortcuts.Creation.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of shortcut creation for PWA.

histogram.name: WebApp.Shortcuts.Deletion.Success
histogram.summary: Records the result of shortcut deletion for a PWA. This occurs when an installed PWA is uninstalled, which can be triggered by user, policy admin, or sync system depending on the situation.

histogram.name: Webapp.SyncInitiatedUninstallResult
histogram.summary: Records uninstallation result for sync initiated uninstalls in the new USS-based web applications system.

histogram.name: Webapp.SystemApps.FreshInstallDuration
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to perform a fresh install of all system web apps. It measures the time from when we dispatch a call to install them, until we get all the installation results. This intentionally excludes the scenario where we don't request to install all the apps for consistency. Recorded in milliseconds, from 1 millisecond to 3 minutes.

histogram.name: WebApp.UninstallDialog.AppMenuUninstallSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the result of uninstalling a WebApp when the user clicks on "Uninstall" from the 3-dot menu of the respective WebApp window.

histogram.name: WebApp.UninstallDialog.AppsPageUninstallSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the result of uninstalling an app from the chrome://apps page. This happens whena user right-clicks on a greyed out webapp icon in the chrome://apps page and clicks "Uninstall".

histogram.name: Webapp.UninstallDialogAction
histogram.summary: Records the user response to the dialog shown when uninstalling a web app.

histogram.name: Webapp.Update.ManifestUpdateResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of web app manifest update checks during page navigations. Note that "No app in scope" results are ignored due to the expected several orders of magnitude higher volume than all other update results.

histogram.name: Webapp.Update.ManifestUpdateResult.DefaultApp
histogram.summary: Identical to Webapp.Update.ManifestUpdateResult but restricted to just default installed web apps.

histogram.name: Webapp.WebAppOriginAssociationFetchResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of web app origin association file fetch when url handlers are present. Happens when PWA is installed or updated.

histogram.name: Webapp.WebAppOriginAssociationParseResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of web app origin association file parsing. Happens after an web app origin association file is fetched.

histogram.name: Webapp.WebAppUrlLoaderPrepareForLoadResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of WebAppUrlLoader::PrepareForLoad().

histogram.name: WebContentsObserver.{Method}
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes to call all observers of the WebContents observer method {Method}. Logged every time the method is called.

histogram.name: WebContextFetcher.Time.RunJavaScript
histogram.summary: Records the number of milliseconds that it takes for a web context fetch to complete. Recorded when the javascript execution completes. To start will be used for Google Lens image queries to track time to retrieve page context, but may extend to other features over time.

histogram.name: WebController.BackForwardListOutOfSync
histogram.summary: [iOS] Counts the number of time the backForwardList of the WebView gets out of sync with the URL exposed by the WebView. This should not happen and is probably an issue in WebKit. This is only recorded when there is an error.

histogram.name: WebController.BackForwardListOutOfSyncInProvisionalNavigation
histogram.summary: [iOS] Records the action take when the backForwardList of the WebView is out of sync with the URL exposed by the WebView when starting a new provisional navigation. The URLs can get out of sync because of a bugs in WebKit. This is only recorded when the URLs are out of sync.

histogram.name: WebController.CertVerificationErrorsCacheHit
histogram.summary: [iOS] Report cache hit/miss for WKWebView cert verification. CRWWKNavigationHandler has a cache of pending cert verification results to avoid extra verifications when presenting SSL interstitial. This metric helps to understand how often this cache miss happens.

histogram.name: WebController.ExternalURLRequestBlocking
histogram.summary: [iOS] Measures the proportion of external URL requests that originate from a subframe without any user interaction (e.g. an advertisement contains an iframe directed at the App Store).

histogram.name: WebFont.BlankTextShownTime
histogram.summary: A histogram tracking the time we spent showing blank text because a web font wasn't available by the time we needed it. Measured once per @font-face that ended up showing blank text.

histogram.name: WebFont.CacheHit
histogram.summary: Recorded upon web fonts load. Counts the number of times web font is loaded from cache (disk cache or memory cache), fetched over network, or served from data URL.

histogram.name: WebFont.Clients.AlignFontDisplayAuto.FontFacesAffected
histogram.summary: The number of 'font-display: auto' web fonts whose display periods are modified to 'swap' or 'failure' before a timeout to ensure a good LCP. This is a diagnostic metric for feature AlignFontDisplayAutoTimeoutWithLCPGoal.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.0.Under10KB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of under 10KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.1.10KBTo50KB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 10KB-50KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.2.50KBTo100KB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 50KB-100KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.3.100KBTo1MB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 100KB-1MB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.4.Over1MB
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of over 1MB.

histogram.name: WebFont.DownloadTime.LoadError
histogram.summary: The time taken for a webfont download that failed. Includes aborted requests.

histogram.name: WebFont.FontDisplayValue
histogram.summary: The value of font-display @font-face descriptor. Counted only when explicitly specified in the @font-face rule.

histogram.name: WebFont.HadBlankText
histogram.summary: This metrics is logged when a page that use web fonts is loaded. The value is whether we had to wait on at least one web font and ended up showing blank text, or not.

histogram.name: WebFont.HttpCacheStatus
histogram.summary: For each http cache transaction for a font in Google Fonts, record the cache status.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadLimitOnDiskCacheMiss
histogram.summary: The load limit state when the first disk-cache-only request fails by cache miss, if WebFonts cache-aware timeout adaptation is enabled and applicable.

histogram.name: WebFont.LocalFontUsed
histogram.summary: Whether a locallly installed font is actually used when @font-face had local sources.

histogram.name: WebHistory.LocalResultMissingOnServer
histogram.summary: Percentage of results that are present locally but are not returned by the web history API call. Recorded every time a signed-in user visits the chrome://history page and the results from the web history are received.

histogram.name: WebHistory.OAuthTokenCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether getting the OAuth token was successful for a web history query. On visits to the chrome://history page this token is obtained and then used to get the user's synced web history.

histogram.name: WebHistory.OAuthTokenResponseCode
histogram.summary: HTTP Response code returned by the server when trying to fetch the OAuth token for a web history query.

histogram.name: WebHistory.QueryCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the web history API call was successful. Every time a signed-in user visits the chrome://history page this query is executed to get the user's synced web history. If successful, the local and remote results are merged and shown in the history page.

histogram.name: WebHistory.ResponseTime
histogram.summary: Time it took for the web history to reply. Recorded when the web history API call triggered by visiting chrome://history receives the data, measuring how much time it took for the server to reply.

histogram.name: WebP.DecodedImageFormat
histogram.summary: Histogram for the format of decoded WebP images on iOS, as Chrome re-encodes WebP images on that platform.

histogram.name: WebShare.ApiCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of calls to navigator.share. Includes both successful and failed shares.

histogram.name: WebShare.ShareOutcome
histogram.summary:
Records the outcome of calls to navigator.share. This will not count any calls that never complete (e.g., if the page closes while the picker is open). Therefore, DO NOT look at the raw percentages of this histogram; instead, compare these numbers with the WebShare.ApiCount.Share total.
NOTE: At the moment, if the user cancels the picker, its recording will be delayed, and possibly never recorded (https://crbug.com/636274), so that will account for a discrepancy between ShareOutcome and ApiCount.Share.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Action
histogram.summary: Tracks actions with the website setting (a.k.a. page info / origin info) bubble, such as opening it up or clicking on the Connection tab.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.AllSitesAction
histogram.summary: Tracks actions with the "All Sites" page in website settings for builds older than M82.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.AllSitesAction2
histogram.summary: Tracks actions with the "All Sites" page in website settings starting in M82.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Discoverability.Action
histogram.summary: Tracks actions related to page info when discoverability has been activated.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Discoverability.TimeToClickHighlight
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time between when the page info is opened and the highlighted permissions section is clicked.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Discoverability.TimeToOpen
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time the discoverability icon is shown in the omnibox before the user clicks into page info.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is changed using the content settings menu.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged.Allowed
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Allowed' using the content settings menu.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged.Ask
histogram.summary: Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Ask' using the content settings menu.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged.Blocked
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Blocked' using the content settings menu.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged.Reset
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is reset to the default value using the content settings menu.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Menu.PermissionChanged.SessionOnly
histogram.summary: Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is changed to the session only value using the content settings menu. This option only exists for cookies.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.OriginInfo.PermissionChanged
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is changed using the Origin Info dialog.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.OriginInfo.PermissionChanged.Allowed
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Allowed' using the Origin Info dialog.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.OriginInfo.PermissionChanged.Blocked
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is set to 'Blocked' using the Origin Info dialog.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: websql.OpenDatabase
histogram.summary: Counts the number of WebSQL databases opened for secure vs insecure origins.

histogram.name: Webstore.ExtensionInstallResult
histogram.summary: The success or failure of all extension installs from the webstore. This includes those initiated by sync.

histogram.name: WebUI.CreatedForUrl
histogram.summary: URLs for which Chrome creates WebUIControllers.

histogram.name: WebUI.Settings.PathVisited
histogram.summary: Paths within chrome://settings visited. For evaluating popularity and priorities for chrome://settings GUI. Note that this metric used to include paths that were part of OS settings, but starting with M-81, this metric only records browser settings paths.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.CloseAction
histogram.summary: The WebUI tab strip is a more touch-friendly tab strip used in place of Chrome's native tab strip in some cases. It can be opened and closed. This records how a user closed it.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.CloseTabAction
histogram.summary: The WebUI tab strip is a more touch-friendly tab strip used in place of Chrome's native tab strip in some cases. This records how a user closed a tab within the WebUI tab strip.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.OpenAction
histogram.summary: The WebUI tab strip is a more touch-friendly tab strip used in place of Chrome's native tab strip in some cases. It can be opened and closed. This records how a user opened it.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.OpenDuration
histogram.summary: The WebUI tab strip is a more touch-friendly tab strip used in place of Chrome's native tab strip in some cases. It can be opened and closed. This records how long it was open when closing.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.TabActivation
histogram.summary: WebUI Tabstrip: Time from activating a tab from WebUI to receiving an activation notification in WebUI.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.TabCreation
histogram.summary: WebUI Tabstrip: Time needed to create all of the tab elements at launch.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.TabDataReceived
histogram.summary: WebUI Tabstrip: Time from requesting the tab data to receiving the data.

histogram.name: WebUsb.ChooserClosed
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the WebUSB device chooser was closed.

histogram.name: WebUsb.NotificationClosed
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the "WebUSB device detected" notification was dismissed.

histogram.name: WebUsb.PermissionRevoked
histogram.summary: Records when the user revokes permission for an origin to connect to a USB device using the WebUSB API.

histogram.name: WebView.ApiCall
histogram.summary: Records calls to WebView APIs in WebViewChromium.

histogram.name: Welcome.SignInPromptResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of promoting sign-in via the Welcome page.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.DefaultPromptResult
histogram.summary: Records whether or not Chrome was the default browser when the user left the Win10-specific Welcome page.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.NewPromoPageAdded
histogram.summary: Emits a "true" sample when the revamped WebUI-based welcome page is added to the startup tabs list. This means that barring an error on startup, it was shown to the user. This histogram can only be recorded during first-run flow, when the EnableWelcomeWin10 experiment is enabled.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.OriginalPromoPageAdded
histogram.summary: Emits a "true" sample when the old external welcome page is added to the startup tabs list. This means that barring an error on startup, it was shown to the user. This histogram can only be recorded during first-run flow, when the EnableWelcomeWin10 experiment is disabled.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.PinCheckTimedOut
histogram.summary: Records whether or not the check that verifies if Chrome is pinned to the taskbar has timed out. This check is done when the welcome page is opened in order to determine which instructions to display to the user.

histogram.name: Welcome.Win10.PinnedPromptResult
histogram.summary: Records whether or not Chrome was pinned to the taskbar when the user left the Win10-specific Welcome page.

histogram.name: WheelScrolling.WasLatched
histogram.summary: Records whether or not a GSU event with wheel source is latched to the current scrolling element. It is false for the first GSU event of every scrolling sequence and true for the rest of the GSU events.

histogram.name: Win8.PageLoad
histogram.summary: Count of page loads in each of the 2 different environments (metro/desktop) on Windows 8.

histogram.name: WindowManager.AppWindowCountPerLoad
histogram.summary: The number of app windows open when a load completes. This includes windows opened by an app shortcut, or apps opened in a popup. This only counts v1 apps.

histogram.name: WindowManager.PopUpWindowCountPerLoad
histogram.summary: The number of popup windows open when a load completes. Popup windows only have one content area (no multiple tabs) and a stripped down toolbar consisting only of a read-only address bar.

histogram.name: WindowManager.TabbedWindowCountPerLoad
histogram.summary: The number of tabbed windows open when a load completes. A tabbed window is a normal browser window which can have one or more tabs.

histogram.name: WindowOcclusionChanged
histogram.summary: A top level window's occlusion state. Recorded each time the state changes.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.Action
histogram.summary: The type of category clicked in the Windows Jumplist

histogram.name: WorkerThread.ExitCode
histogram.summary: Records the exit code of WorkerThread.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.MenuAction
histogram.summary: Number of times that each menu item is clicked.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.RecentTabsSubMenu
histogram.summary: The number of times each tab or window restore option in the Recent Tabs submenu is clicked.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.TimeToAction
histogram.summary: The time a user takes to select a menu item after opening the menu.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.TouchDuration
histogram.summary: Time difference between touch down and touch up on Android wrench button.

histogram.name: X11.XInternAtomFailure
histogram.summary: Counts how often the X11 server fails to register an atom. Recorded when ::XInternAtom fails (returns None). Failure rates will inform whether we implement error handling. https://crbug.com/1000919

histogram.name: XHR.Async.PageDismissal
histogram.summary: Records occurence of async XHR during page dismissal state (unload, beforeunload, pagehide etc).

histogram.name: XHR.Sync.BlockingTime.MainThread
histogram.summary: Records the time spent in sync XHR requests on the main thread.

histogram.name: XHR.Sync.BlockingTime.WorkerThread
histogram.summary: Records the time spent in sync XHR requests in a worker thread.

histogram.name: XHR.Sync.PageDismissal
histogram.summary: Records occurence of sync XHR during page dismissal state (unload, beforeunload, pagehide etc).

histogram.name: XHR.Sync.PageDismissal_forbidden
histogram.summary: Records occurence of sync XHR requests during page dismissal state (unload, beforeunload, pagehide etc) that were forbidden.

histogram.name: XR.ARCore.DepthBufferSizeInPixels
histogram.summary: Recorded on every frame for as long as depth data is requested in an XR session backed by ARCore device. Measures the number of pixels (width * height) in the depth buffer obtained from ARCore.

histogram.name: XR.RuntimeUsed
histogram.summary: Indicates which XR runtime was used for a session. Recorded when the session was successfully created.

histogram.name: XR.WebXR.ReferenceSpace.Requested
histogram.summary: Records which reference space was requested when a site calls XRSession.requestReferenceSpace().

histogram.name: XR.WebXR.ReferenceSpace.Succeeded
histogram.summary: Records which reference spaces are successfully created when the promise returned by XRSession.requestReferenceSpace() is resolved.

histogram.name: ZeroSuggest.AllResults
histogram.summary: The number of results (either query or URL) from ZeroSuggest. This is set every time a successful response from ZeroSuggest is received, which can be every time the user focuses on the omnibox.

histogram.name: ZeroSuggest.QueryResults
histogram.summary: The number of query results returned from ZeroSuggest. This is set every time a successful response from ZeroSuggest is received, which can be every time the user focuses on the omnibox.

histogram.name: ZeroSuggest.URLResults
histogram.summary: The number of URL results returned from ZeroSuggest. This is set every time a successful response from ZeroSuggest is received, which can be every time the user focuses on the omnibox.
